title: Product Designer
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 As a Product Designer, you will be responsible for crafting intuitive and engaging user experiences across our Multi-Brand platform. You'll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and other designers to translate business requirements into compelling designs that delight our global customers. This role will be based in either our Stockholm office.
   

  

 This is a fantastic opportunity to be a key player in a growing team, contributing directly to the success of our global brands and solidifying your position as a core design asset within the company.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Design user-centered interfaces and experiences for our suite of products
* Create high-fidelity prototypes, layouts and user flows
* Create UI animations and micro-interactions to enhance the player experience
* Contribute to our design systems by making essential updates and creating new components
* Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience as a Product Designer, driving projects
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English).
* Highly proficient in design tools such as Figma, with a keen eye for identifying other tools which may allow us to enhance our products.
* Knowledge of UX best practices with a mobile-first and responsive design approach
* Demonstrated ability to take initiative, be self-driven, mentor others, and lead by example.
* Team player with a positive attitude


 NICE TO HAVE:
   

  

* Previous experience in the iGaming industry (or other highly-regulated industries, such as banking) is highly desirable.


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Experience Designer, UX, Kyndryl Vital, Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Role
   

  

 At Kyndryl Vital, UX Designers craft intuitive and user-centered digital experiences that solve real human problems through thoughtful interface design, interaction patterns, and information architecture. This role focuses on creating products that are not only visually appealing but also usable, accessible, and valuable to end-users. Through user research, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing, UX Designers ensure that digital solutions meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

 As a specialist and leader in UX design, you will:
   

  

* Lead UX initiatives across various projects, ensuring interfaces are intuitive, accessible, and aligned with client objectives
* Conduct user research to identify pain points, behaviors, and opportunities for design innovation
* Create user personas, journey maps, and information architecture that inform design decisions
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, and interaction patterns that effectively communicate design concepts
* Facilitate design workshops and user testing sessions to validate design solutions
* Build and maintain strong client relationships, serving as a trusted UX advisor throughout the project lifecycle
* Guide design teams in creating cohesive user experiences across multiple touchpoints and platforms
* Collaborate with developers and product managers to balance user needs with technical feasibility
* Advocate for user-centered design principles throughout the organization
* Own the UX process from discovery and ideation to testing and implementation


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* User-Centered Design: You have a deep understanding of UX methodologies, including user personas, journey mapping, and information architecture.
* Interaction Design: You can create intuitive user flows, navigation patterns, and micro-interactions that enhance usability across digital products.
* Usability Testing: You excel at designing and facilitating usability tests to validate design decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Wireframing & Prototyping: You can create low to high-fidelity prototypes using industry tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD to communicate design concepts effectively.
* User Research: You can plan and conduct both qualitative and quantitative research to uncover user needs, behaviors, and pain points.
* Information Architecture: You have expertise in organizing and structuring complex information to create intuitive navigation systems.
* Accessibility: You understand WCAG guidelines and design inclusive experiences that work for users of all abilities.
* Collaboration: You work effectively with developers, product managers, and stakeholders to translate business requirements into user-friendly solutions.
* UI Design Principles: You have strong knowledge of visual hierarchy, typography, and responsive design to create aesthetically pleasing interfaces.
* UX Writing: You can craft clear, concise microcopy that guides users through digital experiences.
* Co-Creation: You excel at aligning stakeholders through workshops and collaborative sessions.
* Storytelling: You can communicate clearly and compellingly.
* Design with and for AI: You leverage AI tools while maintaining quality and ethical standards.


**Who You Are**
 Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
   

  

* 8+ years experience
* Deep industry vertical experience
* Experience in both enterprise and agency worlds
* Knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure or other technical applications
* Human behavior, change management, or other applied social sciences
* Data science, AI/ML background


 Required Education
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent portfolio


**Preferred Education**
* MDM, MDes, MFA, dMBA or equivalent


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Are you an experienced Product Manager with a passion for making a meaningful difference in people’s lives? At Abilia, we develop Assistive Technologies and Digital Services that empower individuals with disabilities and special needs to live more independently and with enhanced quality of life.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the development and advancement of our digital service platforms — essential tools that support end users, their support persons, and care givers. This role also encompasses responsibility for related products that integrate with these platforms. You’ll be part of an ambitious and innovative team, committed to improve everyday life for people with special needs to increase independence, participation and inclusion in society.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Senior Product Manager, you’ll take full ownership of your product portfolio — from shaping the initial business case and product strategy to managing launches, driving growth, and planning for eventual phase-out. Your focus will be on maximizing user and customer value while ensuring business impact and profitability.
 



  





 You will define a clear roadmap based on market insights, customer and user journeys, and commercial potential. You’ll be responsible for creating and executing business plans, setting strategic direction, and ensuring that products evolve in line with both organizational goals and changing market needs.
 



  





 This role is pivotal in aligning cross-functional teams around a shared product vision — making sure that every step, from idea to phase-out, supports a scalable and sustainable offering.
 



 You’ll work cross-functionally with teams across R&D, Marketing, Sales, QA/RA, Operations and Finance. You’ll also build strong relationships with external stakeholders in our markets.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities** 



* Own the full lifecycle of your products — from business case and concept to launch, growth, and phase-out
* Define and execute product strategies, roadmaps, and business plans that align with company objectives
* Identify market opportunities and generate insights through customer and user research
* Map and optimize customer and user journeys to ensure relevance and impact
* Set and monitor product performance targets, including profitability and customer value metrics
* Lead go-to-market planning and collaborate with marketing and sales on successful product launches
* Ensure products remain competitive, sustainable, and aligned with evolving market and regulatory needs
* Contribute to continuous improvement in product management practices, tools, and processes



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* A university degree in business, engineering, or a related field
* 7+ years of experience in product management or a similar strategic role
* Proven track record of developing and executing product strategies, roadmaps, and business plans
* Strong commercial mindset with experience driving product profitability and growth
* Solid understanding of customer and user journeys, and how to translate insights into product opportunities
* Experience managing product launches and lifecycle transitions, including phase-out planning
* Strong technical understanding and hands-on experience working closely with development teams and technical stakeholders
* Ability to evaluate technical feasibility and make informed trade-off decisions in collaboration with R&D
* Experience from MedTech, HealthTech, Assistive Technology, or social care is a plus
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, with the ability to tailor messages for different audiences



  





**Who You Are** 




 You’re a strategic thinker with strong business acumen and a user and customer-first mindset. You thrive in dynamic environments and are skilled at balancing long-term vision with short-term priorities. With excellent interpersonal skills, you navigate cross-functional collaboration with ease and act as the crucial bridge between tech, business, and the people who rely on our solutions every day.
 



  





**Join us in shaping the future of inclusive, life-changing technology.** 




 At Abilia, your work truly matters.
 



  





**Application and for more information** 




 For more information about the organization and the role, you are warmly welcome to contact the responsible recruitment consultant Erik Düring at +46 70 899 94 69 or reseach conultant Anna Lindekrantz at +46 70 306 29 95.
 



  





 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**About Abilia** 




 Abilia aspires to a socially sustainable and inclusive society where people with special needs feel safe, independent, and are able to participate. We are dedicated to the support of independent living, enabling everybody to live a richer life and we work towards the UN global goals as our assistive aids are tailored to the individual, creating positive outcomes, and delivering a lasting effect for individuals, customers, and society.
 



  





 With more than 50 years of experience and with support from clinical evidence, we know that our assistive aids make a difference. Early interventions is key to improve educational levels, inclusiveness in work life and lifelong health.
 



  





 Abilia is present in Sweden, Norway, United Kingdom, and exports to more than 20 countries. The turnover of Abilia amounts to SEK 450 million and the number of employees is approximately 140. The company is owned by MedCap, a Nordic investor that focuses on established Life Science companies with significant development potential. With focus on user safety, Abilia is certified according to the international standard for medical devices companies, ISO 13485, and works according to the European Union Medical Device Regulation, MDR.
 



  





 Read more: https://www.abilia.com/en

title: Arfve Tech Lab – Stockholm Edition
description:
**A Legacy Is Not Just What We Leave Behind — It’s What We Build for the Future.**
**Arfve Tech Lab – Stockholm Edition** 

**Lead. Build. Engineer. Shape the Next Swedish Tech Breakthrough.** 




 Are you a final-year student at 
 **KTH, Handels or other Stockholm based University** 
  ready to turn your skills into real-world impact?
 



 Do you want to be part of the founding story of the next global consumer tech company, built in Sweden — with 
 **modularity, intelligence, and sustainability** 
  at its core?
 



 At 
 **Arfve** 
 , we’re not just launching a product.
 



 We’re building 
 **Modular Intelligence** 
  — and we’re now recruiting a 8
 **-person leadership team** 
  to co-drive our 
 **crowdfunding accelerator** 
  and campaign launch in September
 **2025** 
 .
 


**Who We Are** 

 Arfve is on a mission to end disposable hardware by rethinking how we build, own, and upgrade tech.
 



 Our first product — the 
 **world’s first 3-piece modular, AI-powered earbud** 
  — lets users swap the battery, chipset, and speaker instead of throwing them away.
 



 We’re already 5 months into the journey, with a 
 **Tech Lab of 35+ international co-creators** 
 , 5 specialized product teams, and early traction in both 
 **B2C and white-label markets** 
 .
 



 Now, it’s time to scale.
 


**The Opportunity** 

 Join the 
 **Arfve Accelerator 2025** 
  — a 16-week deep dive into real-world leadership that could fast-track you into the founding team of one of Sweden’s most ambitious startups.
 


* Solve real engineering and product challenges
* Drive campaigns, community, and strategy
* Own outcomes like a future CxO — not an intern



 Hybrid setup — 
 **Stockholm base preferred** 



**Key Roles We’re Looking to Fill** 

**(Final-Year Students from KTH, Handels, SU & More)** 




 We’re assembling a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, marketers, and builders. You’ll lead a domain, work directly with the founder, and help shape a product that goes global.
 


**Product & Engineering Leadership (KTH, SU, Södertörn Focus)** 

 🔹 
 **Hardware/Systems Engineer** 




 Prototype, test, and optimize modular designs. Collaborate with audio partners and ID teams.
 



 🔹 
 **Embedded Software / Edge AI Engineer** 




 Shape our AI-first OS and firmware. BLE, ML, and real-time processing skills are a plus.
 



 🔹 
 **UX Engineer / AI Interaction Designer** 




 Design voice-first and adaptive sound experiences. Partner with AI and design teams to deliver fluid user interactions.
 



 🔹 
 **Product Systems Lead (Technical PM)** 




 Own end-to-end builds, dev cycles, and system integration across hardware + software.
 


 💼 
 **Business / Brand / Go-to-Market Leadership (Handels + Other Biz/Design Schools)** 

 🔹 
 **Head of Growth & Performance** 




 Launch and optimize marketing funnels, performance strategy, and backer acquisition.
 



 🔹 
 **Head of Community & Campaigns** 




 Activate influencers, backers, and creators. Lead storytelling with a human-first, viral approach.
 



 🔹 
 **Head of Brand & Storytelling** 




 Craft identity, copy, visuals, decks, and motion assets for global traction.
 



 🔹 
 **Strategic Ops & Execution Lead** 




 Own internal coordination across pods, campaign timelines, metrics, and delivery.
 



 🔹 
 **External Partnerships & Investor Relations** 




 Initiate and manage relationships with early investors, campus networks, and strategic partners.
 


**What You’ll Gain** 

 ✅ 16-week leadership sprint (Aug–Nov 2025)
 



 ✅ Remote/hybrid model — Stockholm base preferred
 



 ✅ Work with the Arfve founder, engineers, and global co-creators
 



 ✅ Fast-track into future paid leadership roles
 



 ✅ Build real products — not slides
 


**Who This Is For** 

 Final-year students from:
 


* **KTH** 
  (Mechatronics, Embedded Systems, Industrial Design, HCI, AI/ML, Product Dev)
* **Handels** 
  (Marketing, Entrepreneurship, Innovation, Finance, Business Dev)
* **Stockholm University** 
  (Computer Science, Marketing, UX, HCI)
* **Södertörn** 
  (Business, Sustainability, Communication)
* **Other design, engineering, or tech programs** 
  across Stockholm



 You’re a 
 **builder** 
 , a 
 **thinker** 
 , and a 
 **doer** 
 .
 



 You want to make something that 
 **matters** 
  — and leave your mark.
 


**How to Apply** 

 Send your CV and a short motivation (max 300 words) to:
 



 📧 
 **team@arfve.com** 




**Subject:** 
  Tech Lab Leadership Application – [Your Name]
 



 Let us know:
 


* Which role you’re most excited about
* What you’d love to learn and lead
* Why Arfve speaks to you



  





 #KTH #Handels #StockholmStartups #SwedishTech #ModularIntelligence #EngineeringInternship #StartupJobs #Crowdfunding2025 #BuildWithPurpose #ArfveTechLab

title: E-commerce Manager
description:
**Stureplansgruppen Hotels & Resorts**
*(Bank Hotel, Berns, Skepparholmen, Boo Boo Living, Avalon, Château Le Cagnard)*
 Vill du leda den digitala försäljningsresan för några av Nordens mest ikoniska hotell? Vi söker en affärsdriven
 **E-commerce Manager** 
 som vill ta helhetsansvaret för konvertering, trafik och lönsamhet i våra egna digitala kanaler.
   

  

 Vår portfölj omfattar logi, spa, möten, långtidsboende och restaurangupplevelser - med både B2C- och B2B-kunder, och säsongsstyrd efterfrågan. Du blir en nyckelspelare i att optimera kundresan, stärka vårt eget bokningsflöde och balansera försäljningen mellan egna kanaler, OTA:er och andra partners.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet från e-handel eller digital försäljning i en konkurrensutsatt miljö - gärna från hotell, retail eller resor – och kan driva både strategi och operativ exekvering med datadrivet fokus.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Utveckla och driva en e-commerce-strategi med fokus på direktförsäljning
* Optimera webb och mobil utifrån UX, SEO, innehåll och teknik
* Balansera kanalstrategi: egna kanaler, OTA:er, metasearch och bokningsmotorer
* Arbeta med kampanjplanering, SEM, paid social och CRM tillsammans med team/byrå
* Säkerställa test-och-lär-kultur kring konverteringsoptimering
* Följa upp KPI:er som konverteringsgrad, CPA, ROAS och revenue per session
* Bidra till skalbara strukturer inför framtida expansioner


**Din profil**
* 3–5 års erfarenhet inom e-commerce eller digital försäljning
* God kunskap i SEO, GA4, GTM, CMS och CRO
* Förståelse för försäljning via externa kanaler (OTA, metasearch etc.)
* Meriterande med erfarenhet från hospitality
* Analytisk, samarbetsorienterad och lösningsfokuserad
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En bred och strategisk nyckelroll med stor påverkan
* En kreativ och entreprenöriell miljö med starka varumärken
* Möjligheten att bygga upp strukturer från grunden
* En kultur där passion, utveckling och gemenskap är centralt

title: Product Owner Portals (Merchant & Consumer) (m/f/d)
description:
**We are looking for a**
**Product Owner Portals (Merchant & Consumer) (m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our locations in Oslo, Stockholm, Varberg, Copenhagen or Helsinki – flexible working conditions available**
**Position Overview**
 As the Product Owner for our Merchant and Consumer Portals, you will play a crucial role in shaping the direction and functionality of our digital platforms. You will be responsible for gathering and prioritizing product requirements, translating them into actionable user stories, and ensuring that our development teams deliver high-quality products that meet the needs of our users. Your expertise in the FinTech sector, along with your ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, will drive the success of our portals.
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Gather and analyze requirements from stakeholders, merchants, and consumers to ensure alignment with business objectives.
* Create and prioritize a product backlog, writing clear and actionable user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Collaborate closely with engineering, design, and QA teams throughout the development lifecycle to ensure timely and quality delivery.
* Act as the primary point of contact for all product-related inquiries and decisions, providing clarity and guidance to the team.
* Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, user feedback, and market trends to identify opportunities for enhancement and innovation.
* Facilitate stakeholder meetings and support communication between business operations and the development team to ensure clarity on delivered features across all relevant teams.
* Champion a customer-centric approach, advocating for user needs and ensuring a seamless experience across both portals.


**What will you need?**
* 3+ years of experience as a Product Owner or similar role in the FinTech space, preferably with a focus on digital portals or platforms.
* Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and experience working in Agile environments.
* Proven ability to translate complex requirements into clear and actionable user stories.
* Excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills.
* Analytical mindset with experience in using data to drive product decisions and improvements.
* Familiarity with UX/UI principles and best practices for web and mobile applications.
* You communicate fluently in English.


**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Customer Relationship Management Specialist
description:
As a CRM & Campaign Specialist, you will play a critical role in configuring, maintaining, and optimizing our CRM system, as well as leading the planning, execution, and performance tracking of end-to-end marketing campaigns. You will support our Client Development function, collaborating closely with various internal stakeholders across the company, particularly with the marketing team, sales team and IT, to ensure the system is aligned with business processes and user needs.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include** 



* Manage, optimize, and ensure data accuracy and compliance within HubSpot.
* Configure and customize the CRM to support business workflows.
* Generate structures to maintain a high data quality level.
* Import data and establish procedures for validating and executing the data import.
* Coordinate and execute marketing campaigns, leveraging CRM data, automation tools, and digital marketing channels.
* Integrate the Pharmetheus identified customer journey into HubSpot stages, proposing initiatives to enhance the customer experience, increase conversion rates, and improve satisfaction.
* Support Management, Sales, and Marketing to maximize usage of the CRM and generate customized detailed reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics (leads, conversions, customer lifecycle, revenue, ROI, etc.) and communicate findings to stakeholders.
* Serve as system administrator for HubSpot and related platforms, managing access rights and ensuring security.
* Train and support team members on CRM, campaign management, and digital marketing tools.
* Recommend and implement improvements to enhance the user experience and increase adoption.
* Create and maintain user guides and documentation.
* Coordinate with external vendors as needed.

title: Lead Game Designer - Games
description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Lead Game Designer to join THE FINALS game team here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering around ~100 developers.
   

  

 As a Lead Game Designer at Embark, you will be responsible for detailed design work on the project, as well as instigating and reviewing the designs of other designers. You will collaborate closely with the directors of the project, in refining concepts and ideas into tangible designs, prototypes and features, as well as working with Production leadership in helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

 We would like you to take on managerial responsibilities for some of the projects’ Design staff, as well as coach and mentor the projects Game Designers in design methodology and documentation practices. And inspire them to deliver high quality, balanced and scalable systems and player experiences, fitting for Live Service and Free-to-play PvP Action Games.
   

  

 You will also own and spearhead game features directly, and work hands-on in cross disciplinary teams while implementing gameplay features
   

  

**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind.
* 10+ years of experience designing and making games and a proven track record with multiple shipped titles.
* An excellent grasp of AAA PvP gameplay and systems design, including knowledge of player psychology, UX design, gameplay mechanics and dynamics.
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience with Blueprints and scripting.
* Able to adapt to varied learning and communication styles of team members and stakeholders.
* A good knowledge and familiarity with the various game maker disciplines, coding, animation, game physics, 3D Art, etc.
* Enjoyment of creative collaboration in cross disciplinary groups.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Product Area Manager
description:
**Är du redo för din nästa utmaning – kanske finns den inom Vattenfall?**
 Om du, liksom vi vill göra skillnad genom att möjliggöra fossilfrihet, så kanske denna öppning är något för dig? Uppdraget för vårt team, är att skapa värde till våra kunder, dels genom att erbjuda de centrala lösningar bestående av solenergi- och energilagringslösningar – dvs ren, distribuerad och förnybar energi – dels tjänster kopplade till dessa produkter. Ett annat nyckelområde för vårt team är att koppla samman och optimera energisystemet där anslutna decentraliserade energiresurser (DER) skapar värde i form av flexibilitet som behövs för att stabilisera det nationella nätet, hantera obalanser i energihandel, överbelastning av elnätet mm dvs stor nytta för samhället. Vårt bidrag till Vattenfalls syfte att möjliggöra ett fossilfritt liv.
   

  

 Som
 *Product Area Manager* 
 inom Customers & Solutions (C&S) Nordics kommer du tillsammans med vårt team att utveckla DES-verksamheten i Sverige och Finland. Speciellt fokus för dig kommer att vara att ansvara för produktområdet Entreprenadaffären dvs för solpaneler, växelriktare, batterier mm som ingår i de anläggningar vi säljer. Detta inkluderar hela produktlivscykeln från strategi och planering till genomförande, inklusive go-to-market och lansering, samt efteranalys, till kontinuerlig utveckling och underhåll samt eventuell avveckling framgent.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som
 **Product Area manager** 
 arbetar du tillsammans med resten av teamet och är experten rörande ditt produktområde, alltså för de idag existerande produkterna och de som är under utveckling. Rollen syftar till att uppnå intäkts- och kundnöjdhetsmålen inom givna budget och tidsramar. Balans mellan affärsmål, kundbehov och tekniska överväganden å ena sidan och å den andra säkerställandet av att långsiktiga mål nås.  I ansvaret ingår att definiera produktstrategin och visionen inklusive go-to-market-strategi inom produktområdet vilken skall vara i linje med DES övriga produktportfölj och Business Unit Customer Nordics strategi och mål.
   

  

 Samarbete med externa partners samt andra delar av DES och Vattenfall är en viktig del av det dagliga arbetet som inkluderar människor, processer och teknik.
   

  

**I Rollen Ingår Bland Annat Att**
* Ansvar och hantering av DES-portföljens produkter genom produktens livscykel för att säkerställa förmågan att erbjuda kunderna konkurrenskraftiga, CSR- och juridiskt godkända säljbara och fakturbara produkter vid alla tidpunkter.
* Definiera produktstrategi och vision inklusive go-to-market-strategi inom produktområdet.
* Ansvara för produktens lönsamhet vilket inkluderar att beräkna och ange golvpris för nyutvecklade produkter
* Skapa och upprätthålla roadmap för utveckling och lansering av produkter och funktioner inom produktområdet
* Kontinuerligt samla in marknads-/regulatorisk/konkurrentinput samt kundfeedback från olika källor, och definiera krav på nya/förbättrade produkter/funktioner
* Hantera prioritering i olika forum inom DES samt produktbacklogg för produktområdet


 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Akademisk examen som Civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Längre erfarenhet från liknande befattning
* God förståelse för möjligheterna inom det snabbt framväxande digitala området samt inom energilandskapet
* God förståelse för affärslogiken i olika affärssegment
* Flytande muntligt/skriftligt på svenska och engelska. Finska är en merit


 Som person ser vi att du har följande förmågor:
   

  

* En förmåga att inte bara förstå kundernas behov utan också att omvandla till relevanta erbjudanden, tjänster och lösningar med hög kvalitet
* "Få saker gjorda"-mentalitet; förmåga och mod att arbeta med ämnen av både operativ och strategisk karaktär med siktet inställt på helhetsbilden
* Äkta laganda; att stödja och sparra med varandra är avgörande för nå framgång och är något du skriver under på och gärna gör
* Förmåga att driva förändring och arbeta i stora och komplexa organisationer och att effektivt hantera interna och externa gränssnitt och samarbeten vilket ibland kräver flexibilitet, tänkande utanför boxen och en förmåga att behålla lugnet oavsett situation.


 Övriga kvalifikationer
   

  

* Driven, affärsmässig och med hög grad av uthållighet
* Analytiskt tänkesätt
* Strukturerad och självständig och samtidigt flexibel och pragmatisk


 Ytterligare information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Solna
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com. Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00 Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna), Mikael Mukka (SEKO)
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 24-08-2025.** 
 Vänligen ansök enbart med ditt CV, vi tar inte emot Personligt Brev. Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Tech Lead - Frontend
description:
*Tele2 is looking for a Tech Lead for Frontend to help drive the evolution of our digital sales and service platforms within the B2C IT Engineering department. This is a strategic and hands-on role for someone ready to take architectural ownership of our frontend stack, mentor other developers, and help shape our chapter ways of working.*
 Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**This is the job**
 As a Tech Lead for frontend you’ll be the technical and strategic driver of our frontend direction for several teams. You’ll take ownership of architectural decisions, set engineering standards, and work closely with the E2E architecture team to ensure our frontend aligns with Tele2’s long-term platform vision.
   

  

 You’ll lead by example, mentoring developers, guiding implementation, and fostering a culture of high-quality, maintainable code. Your influence will extend across teams and chapters, helping shape how we build, test, and ship modern web experiences.
   

  

 This is a key leadership role where you’ll balance hands-on development with architectural oversight and team coaching. You’ll work closely with backend teams, design and digital product teams to deliver scalable and elegant solutions that power our digital sales and service platforms.
   

  

*This position is based at our headquarters in Kista, Stockholm, with a hybrid work model requiring three days per week in the office.*
**Who are you?**
* A natural technical leader who enjoys building up teams, sharing knowledge, and driving frontend excellence across the organization
* Experienced in leading or contributing to frontend chapters, and motivated to improve ways of working at scale
* A team player who works closely with others from idea to delivery, and values shared ownership over individual heroics
* Passionate about growing people — you coach, mentor, and actively support the development of those around you
* Excited to drive technical direction, set standards, and help align teams on frontend architecture and tooling
* Curious and proactive, with a strong belief in continuous learning, for yourself and the chapter as a whole


**This Is What You Have**
 You’re a technical leader who thrives on solving complex challenges, coaching others, and thinking long-term. You bring:
   

  

* Excited Strong hands-on experience in TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Curious Experience in Astro, MongoDB and Vanilla Extract is a plus
* A deep understanding of frontend architecture, design systems, and component reuse
* Experience working in complex domains with business logic at scale
* Passion for modern engineering practices, collaboration, and continuous improvement

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and Computer and Network Security
description:
**What you'll get to do** 




 You'll play a pivotal role in moving our new frontend forward, collaborating closely with your team to deliver innovative solutions that delight our users. You´ll team up with frontenders in the team to drive all of our technical projects on the Frontend side and create the best possible plattform for Detectify and our customers. You'll work in a cloud-first environment, leveraging your expertise to create scalable and performant applications that make a significant impact on our product and the user experience.
 



 We foster an enabling and empowered culture where you'll have the freedom to utilize your full skill set and express your unique personality. We encourage open, passionate discussions to fuel our collective learning and growth, creating a fun and engaging environment where your contributions are valued.
 



  





**As an Front-end engineer in a cross-functional product team** 
 , you'll contribute to the entire development cycle: ideation to iteration, and everything in between:
 



 - Collaborate with engineers, designers, product managers, researchers, and data analysts in a dynamic and empowered product-driven environment
 



 - Drive architecture together with your team within your domain and contribute to decisions across teams
 



 - Use the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale
 



 - Explore modern software development methods
 



 - Occationally contribute to the full stack
 



 - Participate in cross-team efforts to improve our architecture or development environment
 



  





**Technologies you will get your hands on (some not all):** 




 - React, TypeScript, GraphQL (Apollo Federation)
 



 - AI powered tools such co-pilot and alike
 



 - BE technologies such as: Go (Golang), Kafka, Terraform, AWS ECS/Lambda/AppSync/RDS/DynamoDB
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**Who you are** 



* You're energized by understanding user needs and translating them into intuitive, high-impact solutions.
* You have a deep understanding of modern frontend technologies and best practices, and you're always eager to learn and grow.
* You have experienced in frontend architecture and have driven technical projects from inception to completion.
* You are eager to contribute to the full tech stack
* You embrace collaborative development approaches like pair or mob programming, valueing the diverse perspectives they bring to the table.
* You´re proficient in cloud technologies, especially AWS, and understand backend integration.



  





**So, what do you think?** 




 We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about security! Go hack yourself!
 



  





**Hybrid work** 




 This position is for the Stockholm office.
 *We do not offer remote working or offer relocation for this position*

title: EA/Koncernarkitekt till E-hälsomyndigheten
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care and Government Administration
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala myndighet? Vi söker en strategisk och drivande koncernarkitekt som vill leda utvecklingen av vår enterprisearkitektur och göra skillnad för samhällsnyttan.
   

  

****Om tjänsten****
 Tjänsten innebär att agera som koncernarkitekt inom myndigheten, med ansvar för att leda och utveckla myndighetens arbete inom enterprisearkitektur. Du kommer att vara en del av myndighetens koncernarkitekturfunktion och bidra till utvecklingen av myndighetens arkitekturramverk, it-strategi och tillhörande tillämpningsanvisningar. I rollen ingår att ge stöd till myndighetens verksamhetsavdelningar i frågor som rör ramverk och metodik samt att säkerställa att beslutade strategier och riktlinjer följs. Du förväntas även ge stöd i kravprocessen och säkerställa att kravställningen översätts till välgrundade arkitekturprinciper och lösningsförslag som bidrar till en sammanhållen och hållbar utveckling av myndighetens verksamhet och it-landskap. Du kommer att ingå i en tvärfunktionell enhet som jobbar tillsammans för att stödja myndighetens övergipande strategiska mål och förflyttingar.
   

  

****Om avdelningen****
 Avdelningen digital strategi och plattform ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor inom arkitektur, it-/informationssäkerhet, UX, portföljhantering, plattformsförmågor, drift, support och digital arbetsplats. Enheten digital strategi, där tjänsten är placerad, fokuserar på strategisk planering och rådgivning med ansvar för myndighetens långsiktiga planering och digitala transformation.
   

  

****Om dig****
 Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, då de är avgörande för hur du kommer att trivas och lyckas i rollen. Du är en strukturerad och självgående person som arbetar strategiskt och har ett brett perspektiv på komplexa frågor. Med din helhetssyn kan du identifiera långsiktiga lösningar som skapar värde för hela organisationen. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och bidrar till gemensamma mål med ett lösningsfokuserat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* akademisk utbildning som civilingenjör, systemvetare eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med it-arkitektur
* erfarenhet av modelleringsnotationer som Archimate och Unified Modeling Language (UML) och relevanta verktyg
* förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska
* förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på engelska


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**
* erfarehet av arbete i enterprise-/koncernarkitekturfunktion där organisationens strategi och riktning realiseras arkitekturellt
* certifiering(ar) inom arkitektur
* erfarenhet av förmågemodellering
* erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i portföljstyrning


****Vad erbjuder vi?****
 Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
   

  

****Är du intresserad?****
 Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av:
   

  

 Enhetschef Johan Palmqvist: 010-106 07 26
   

  

 Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av:
   

  

 HR-specialist Gabriela Plachecka: gabriela.plachecka@ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den
 **4 augusti 2025** 
 . Ladda upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att återupptas i augusti. Observera att under sommarperioden kommer vi ha begränsad möjlighet att svara på telefon och mail.
   

  

 Urvalsfrågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen.
 **Att besvara urvalsfrågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.** 
 Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på urvalsfrågorna och inte hänvisar till
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är
 **Stockholm eller Kalmar** 
 . Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan dessa två orter.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
   

  

****Om E-hälsomyndigheten****
 E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar cirka 500 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: Software Engineer Java Backend
description:
We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer (Java Backend) to join our growing consulting team. As a consultant, you will work with leading companies in the Nordic region, delivering high-quality backend solutions as part of agile, cross-functional teams. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys technical challenges, collaboration, and making a real impact in client-facing projects.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Develop and maintain backend services using Java and Spring Boot
  
Design and implement microservices and REST APIs
  
Work with Docker and Kubernetes to build and run containerized services
  
Manage deployment pipelines using GitHub Actions
  
Automate infrastructure using Terraform and Helm
  
Collaborate with product owners, developers, testers, and DevOps engineers in agile project teams
  
Monitor, troubleshoot, and continuously improve system performance and reliability
  
  

Required
  
Solid experience in backend development with Java and Spring Boot
  
Proficient in building REST APIs and working with microservices architecture
  
Hands-on knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
  
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, particularly GitHub Actions
  
Experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud Platform
  
Strong communication skills in English
  
Based in Stockholm or open to working onsite in Stockholm (hybrid flexibility available)
  
  

Nice to Have
  
Experience with Kafka, Solace, or other messaging systems
  
Knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code tools like Terraform and Helm
  
Prior consulting experience in client-facing projects
  
Domain experience in banking, e-commerce, or airline technology
  
  

Personal Attributes
  
Proactive and self-driven
  
Strong team player and communicator
  
Open to learning and adapting to different client environments
  
Quality- and delivery-focused
  
  

Other Details
  
**Workload:** Full-time
  
**Employment Type:** Consulting assignment
  
**Location:** Stockholm (hybrid flexibility possible)
  
**Start Date:** Immediate availability preferred

title: Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a motivated and curious Software Engineer to join our small development team. In this position, you will be involved in designing, building, testing, and improving digital systems and applications in collaboration with other team members. You will work with modern tools and participate in the full software development cycle.
  
What We Offer
  
An engaging and supportive work environment
  
A team-oriented culture with mentoring and knowledge sharing
  
Opportunities to work on real projects and develop your skills continuously
  
A stable role with flexibility and long-term potential
  
  

Requirements
  
A strong willingness to learn and work collaboratively in a development team
  
Knowledge or Great Interest about .Net MAUI
  
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT, or a related field
  
Basic programming skills in at least one common language (e.g., Java, Python, C#, or JavaScript)
  
Good communication skills in English (or Urdu)
  
  

Preferred Qualifications (Not Required)
  
Experience with tools such as Git, or any other source control
  
Participation in academic or personal software projects
  
Familiarity with agile working methods or development frameworks
  
  

Position Details
  
**Type of employment:** Permanent
  
**Start date:** As soon as possible or by agreement
  
**Location:** Stockholm (with possible flexibility for hybrid work)
  
**Salary:** According to agreement or applicable collective agreement
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Delivery Unit Head
description:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centred around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.
  
HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we've never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We've always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments—no matter how big or small—can be traced back to an idea's single spark.
  
  

**Job Title:** DU Head 1(Client Facing)
  
**Location:** Helsingborg
  
**Job Type:** Full-time
  
**Experience Level:** 25+ years
  
  

**About the Role:**  

This position requires an engineering professional with substantial experience in the retail domain, data and analytics, AI/ML, application modernization, and cloud-native transformation. The role involves expertise in large program and portfolio management, software products/platforms delivery, the software development life cycle, agile methodologies, and the development of high-performance teams utilizing multi-shoring strategies. Knowledge of emerging technologies such as Generative AI and AI Operations (AIOps) within IT service delivery is necessary. Responsibilities include working on transforming complex retail applications into scalable, cloud-native solutions, fostering collaboration with client stakeholders, and ensuring the delivery of high quality software solutions.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Oversee governance and performance management across multiple program portfolios in different client business areas.
  
Provide leadership and apply knowledge of program governance models, KPI tracking, statement of work (SoW) delivery, and contemporary contracting models.
  
Establish and maintain client relationships at senior executive levels.
  
Review solutions and artifacts for the development of high-quality, scalable, distributed systems.
  
Utilize understanding of enterprise technology landscapes, including integration, data, and hybrid infrastructure, to build, enhance and support products and platforms.
  
Drive ongoing service enhancements using automation and AI/GenAI.
  
Ensure high collaboration with client business and engineering stakeholders to assess and align with their needs and expectations.
  
Identify and implement Generative AI use cases for operational intelligence, natural language processing in support systems, and customer insights.
  
Promote a culture of high performance in distributed teams through mentoring, training, coaching, and leadership development.
  
Conduct workshops and develop architecture blueprints, modernization roadmaps, and documentation for transformation programs.
  
Contribute to RFP solutions and responses for clients.
  
Manage P&L, commercial models, and optimization initiatives.
  
Develop resource and staffing plans to ensure timely fulfillment of critical program requirements.
  
Monitor CSAT/NPS scores and contribute to growth and profitability within the portfolio.
  
  

**Required Experience:**  

Minimum of 25 years' experience in program management, SDLC, and solution architecture, including at least 3 years in retail domain projects.
  
Proficient with one or more cloud technologies (Azure, GCP, AWS).
  
Expertise in software engineering practices across various technologies and programming languages (Java, Scala, Python, etc.), DevOps, and transitioning commercial products to modern technology stacks.
  
Experience with Site Reliability Engineering practices on enterprise platforms.
  
Familiarity with LLMs and Generative AI frameworks (e.g., Amazon Bedrock, OpenAI) and their integration into enterprise workflows.
  
Understanding of cybersecurity, compliance standards such as GDPR, responsible AI, and AI Governance in Enterprise settings.
  
  

**Education:**  

Master's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field.
  
  

**Preferred Certifications:**  

AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner / Azure Cloud
  
Machine Learning
company_description: We bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress.

title: Solution Architect | Data & Product Enabling Functions | Inter IKEA
description:
* **Job ID:** REF19470B-2
* **Date posted:** 24/07/2025
* At IKEA we are on a journey to transform our operating model. One way to ensure long-term success and a fantastic partner, co-worker, and customer experience is to strengthen our Data & Digital Product Management capabilities. We are establishing data & digital product teams across Inter IKEA, bringing business processes, people, data and technology together. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question, and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things!
* **About the area**
* Operations Management works together with operations teams across Inter IKEA to lead and develop the overall IKEA operating model, and to enable strategic movements towards IKEA goals. It includes teams for business insights, capability and process development, strategy and roadmap, data and product, and technology and platforms.
* **Job description**
* We are currently establishing a product and platform-based organisation, where product areas will enable development of the needed and prioritised capabilities across Inter IKEA. Our aim is to secure a strong and clear connection between business strategies and the goals for each product team. A new framework is being developed to define how we lead in the process and capability dimensions and how this will connect to the data product, digital product and platform management. Our aim is to create a clear and simple framework for Inter IKEA that will enable product teams to deliver value to our customers, co-workers, and partners in an efficient and scalable way, connecting functions and improving collaboration across the IKEA value chain.
* In the work it is expected to understand the current architecture, define a future-oriented target architecture and a logical sequence of activities on how to reach the target state in a stepwise approach. For this role we are looking for architects with a product mindset, also called product architects. Product architects are aligned with one or more product teams. They translate the enterprise/information architecture to the context for product teams and support the implementation.  

You are a natural leader, a team player and a person that actively collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to get progress and reach concrete business results.
* **More specifically, in this role you will be accountable for:**
* + Shaping ideas – in close collaboration with relevant internal and external stakeholders – into concrete, robust and appropriate Process, People. Data and Technology solution architectures and transition roadmap.
	+ Describe the current and future state of intended business change as well as the transition to reach the future state ensuring aligned and consistent business process and IT development across IKEA value chain.
	+ Secure that the transition roadmap reflects the level of uncertainty of the future state. Balance the transformations of foundational building blocks with continued business value delivery.
	+ Communicate and baseline the solution architectures and transition roadmaps with relevant business and IT stakeholders within and across organization(s).
	+ Collaborate closely with Enterprise/Information architects and product teams to improve architecture with learnings from the implementation.
* **About You**
* You will be an experienced and dynamic Solution Architect with a focus on Data and Product domains. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in digital and data products, data as a product, data management, possessing hands-on experience as a product owner, solution architect or developer. This role requires excellent communication and collaboration skills, the ability to lead cross-functionally, and a strong understanding of data and analytics frameworks.
* **With the focus on Data and Product Architecture and co-responsibility for the development and delivery of:**
* + D&P architecture guidelines
	+ Target architecture of the data products
	+ Data and business capabilities
	+ Roadmap
	+ Reusable patterns
	+ Approved exceptions
	+ Support a culture of data-driven decision making across IKEA organisations.
	+ Work closely together with data scientists, data and software engineers, architects, analysts, data & digital product teams, and other relevant roles across IKEA as well as in your team.
	+ Drive continuous improvement, collaboration and knowledge sharing of the data landscape and its value.
	+ Collaborate and communicate with other parts of the organisation to understand needs of stakeholders and advise viable solutions.
	+ Experience in data architecture or solution architecture.
	+ Experience in Azure, Microsoft technologies.
	+ Architecture modelling expertise and a solid understanding of the underlying capabilities, processes, applications, data and technology.
	+ In-depth knowledge of all angles of data, like data management, data governance, analytics, modelling.
	+ Technology knowledge of data platforms, data integration/sharing and data management and governance tools.
	+ Act as the translator between different subject matter experts to move with a common understanding in the chosen direction.
	+ Translate concepts in concrete action plans.
* **Qualifications**
* + Min. 2 years relevant job experience
	+ Bachelor’s/University level in computer science, information technology, engineering, or another STEM disciple
	+ Experience in agile practices and ways of working
	+ Analytical skills and eye for detail
	+ Planning and organisational skills
	+ Effective communicator, able to present content and gain buy-in
	+ Excellent English language skills (written and verbal communication)
* **More Information**
* This role is full-time (40 hours per week) and based in Delft, Netherlands or Malmo, Sweden. This role sits in the Operations Management, Data and Product and reports to the Architecture Manager within Data & Product.
* **Interested? Please send us your CV in English, by Sunday 17th August 2025.**
* *Please be aware that there will be a delay in the response and in the overall process, due to the summer period. We at IKEA, thank you for your patience*
* We always recruit based on values, competence, potential and diversity. We will prioritise co-workers employed in Inter IKEA Systems BV, Inter IKEA Services BV, Inter IKEA Systems Service AB and Inter IKEA Technology Services AB provided competence requirements are met for the roles, starting with the ones whose position cease to exist.
* At IKEA, we do things a little differently. We think differently, act differently and work differently as well. We like to break things. Like rules. And then make things. Like music-playing lamps. And beds disguised as sofas. Even plantballs that help us look after our planet. It’s all part of our vision - to create a better everyday life for the many. And it’s been keeping our co-workers going for over 75 years. By 2030, we hope to help millions more look forward to going home. Maybe you can help us?
* We want to become an even more affordable, sustainable and accessible home furnishing retailer in an omni-channel reality. We bring business and data & technology together to improve how we work and meet customers, and enable us to focus on creating value. So we can continuously improve and scale IKEA, together with our partners and the many people.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: AI Product Manager
description:
At AstraZeneca, Pharmaceutical Technology and Development (PT&D) is pivotal in transforming molecules into groundbreaking medical treatments. PT&D leads the charge in developing innovative drug formulations and delivery technologies that ensure our products' efficacy, safety, and quality. We are seeking an AI Product Manager to be a driving force in embedding AI capabilities and culture, positioning our team at the forefront of AI transformation and innovation.


Are you ready to operate with agility, seamlessly crossing between strategic vision and detailed execution?


This role demands collaboration with partners across the organization, balancing technical expertise with strong communication and change management skills to drive user adoption and facilitate organisational transformation. Can you assess customer maturity in AI and adapt your approach to emphasise either technical leadership or interpersonal skills for successful delivery? Your mission will include AI product lifecycle management, establishing governance frameworks, adhering to regulatory standards, and overseeing strategies to build data science and AI competencies at scale. Community management is central: you'll run knowledge-sharing sessions, cultivate a network of champions, and spotlight emerging talent.

**Accountabilities:**
---------------------

* Lead the design and delivery of organisational AI and data science learning strategies—including formal training, workshops, hackathons, and events.
* Act as the voice of the business to prioiritise building what matters most to enable the strategic goals of PT&D.
* Be a strategic partner and advocate for AI products within and beyond the PT&D organization.
* Ensure alignment with enterprise standards and priorities through close collaboration with other AI Product Managers.
* Promote the adoption and use of AI products across business units, driving cultural and operational change in how data is used.
* Define and track key AI adoption metrics to evaluate impact and inform future initiatives.
* Develop and sustain an engaging community of practice, including regular sharing sessions, communications, and knowledge exchanges.
* Identify skills gaps, benchmark industry trends, and guide learning interventions to support professional growth and business priorities.
* Act as a thought leader and visible ambassador for the AI and data science community, championing best practice and innovation.
* Create, curate, and deliver impactful content and communications for different audiences, including executive leaders, technical specialists, and general staff.
* Promote continuous learning and development in AI technologies, fostering increased adoption and effective utilisation of AI tools across the organization.
* Drive the organization-wide adoption of the data science platform across PT&D.
* Develop and implement comprehensive migration plans to transition existing data science tools and workflows onto the centralised data science platform.

**Essential Skills/Experience:**
--------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.
* Experience working in or directly supporting CMC drug development in the pharma industry is desirable
* Expertise in designing and delivering learning experiences, training, or events for technical and non-technical audiences.
* Experience working in AI Product Management.
* Experience bringing innovation to bear on solving complex and multi-dimensional issues from an operational, technical, financial, and human perspective.
* Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to influence, inspire, and lead change at all levels.
* Extensive experience in leading or managing AI and data science capability-building programs, preferably in a large, matrixed organization.
* Deep understanding of data science, machine learning, and AI concepts; practical proficiency in at least one data science subject area desirable.
* Demonstrated success in community management and partnership development.
* Skilled in using Agile tools (e.g., Jira) and methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).
* Strategic thinking, problem-solving, attention to detail, and agility to adapt in a rapidly changing environment.
* Solid understanding of software development processes, cloud technologies, APIs, and system architectures.
* Demonstrated ability to identify relevant data sources and establish robust data pipelines.

**Desirable Skills/Experience:**
--------------------------------

* Proactive and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and managing competing priorities.
* Passionate about delivering value through technology and continuous improvement.


When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we fuel bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and daring world.


At AstraZeneca, our work directly impacts patients by transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak by combining innovative science with leading digital technology platforms. With a passion for impacting lives through data analytics, AI, machine learning, and more, we are at a crucial stage of becoming a digital and data-led enterprise. Join us as we build partnerships and ecosystems that drive scale and speed for exponential growth. Our dynamic environment offers countless opportunities to learn and grow while innovating with innovative technology.


Ready to make a difference? Apply now to join our team!
company_description: Build unrivalled capabilities in a place that promotes learning agility and offers development opportunities. We never standstill so you’ll have the chance to constantly grow your abilities.

title: Senior IT Specialist
description:
**About Us**

*CellaVision works to advance laboratory workflow and diagnostic certainty through intelligent microscopy. We are a world leader in digital microscopy and offer a full solution including instruments and reagents. Our products are used in health care services around the globe.*

*We work at the forefront of technology and use many of the latest advances in programming, chemistry, digital imaging, and machine learning. Joining our company means you will play an essential role in elevating healthcare through the evolution of microscopy.*

**How will you contribute?**


As an Senior IT Specialist, your primary objective is to drive the establishment, development, and ongoing maturation of our core IT infrastructure. This role demands a hands-on approach to ensure our systems are robust and secure.


This role requires **broad technical competence** – you understand systems at a high level and can connect the dots between hardware, software, and organizational requirements to ensure the reliability, security, and scalability of our IT infrastructure.

**Your Responsibilities**


Key responsibilities will include:

* Designing, implementing, and managing enterprise IT infrastructure.
* Overseeing and optimizing virtualization environments.
* Developing and maintaining robust storage solutions.
* Implementing and managing comprehensive backup and disaster recovery systems.
* Configuring, troubleshooting, and securing networking components.
* Applying and enforcing good security practices across all infrastructure layers.
* Adhering to and implementing the ITIL framework, with a particular emphasis on being experienced in change management processes.
* You will also help with 2nd level support touching areas such as Windows/Linux environments, backups, network infrastructure, different software packages and security devices.

**About You / Your Skills & Experience**


We are seeking a highly experienced and proactive individual who thrives in building resilient and secure IT environments.


Higher vocational education aimed towards IT management/IT security.

**You should possess**

* Extensive experience with enterprise IT infrastructure.
* Proven expertise in virtualization, storage and backup.
* Strong practical competency with both Linux and Windows server operating systems.
* A demonstrated history of implementing and maintaining good security practices.
* Familiarity with the ITIL framework, and specifically having experience with change management.
* You have good knowledge of English, both spoken and written.

**Highly Valued**

* While not a strict requirement, 10+ years of experience is an advantage for this senior-level position.
* Experience with networking and firewalls.
* Familiarity with providing SaaS cloud services.
* Knowledge of ERP systems.
* Some level of managerial experience or product ownership.

**What We Offer**


At CellaVision, we believe that Employee Recognition, Communication & Collaboration, Innovation & Continuous Improvement help us develop into the very best version of ourselves. Our culture is one of teamwork, partnerships, and caring relations. We also believe in having fun together!


We offer flexible working hours and depending on the work role the possibility of partly work from home. Through our collective agreement, you have substantial insurance coverage both if you fall ill and for your retirement. It also provides a time bank for some extra time off and new parents a supplement when staying home with their small child.


We believe in having fun together and meet for breakfast on Fridays, different team activities and company festivities. Some of our engaged team members lead sport activity groups, games nights and meet ‘n’ eat lunches. CellaVision offers a generous wellness allowance to support a healthy lifestyle, a free gym, a parking garage for bicycles and access to showers.

**Ready to Join Us?**


This is a full-time position based at our HQ in Lund, Sweden – a modern office with great infrastructure and commuting options. We’re looking for someone to start as soon as possible.

**Apply Now!** Follow the application form and attach your resume. We’re excited to hear from you!


Please note that you need a valid working permit in Sweden for this role. You may be subject to background checks.

**Diversity is in our blood.**


CellaVision is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of race, nationality, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic.


We decline all contact regarding services in advertising, consulting, or recruitment.

**Working together** with human and artificial intelligence **to advance diagnostics**. - it’s in our blood.

title: Platschef lokalvård till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset Solna /ISS
description:
ISS är ett av världens största tjänsteföretag och snart firar vi 80 år i Sverige! Med över 6500 medarbetare i landet, från norr till söder, levererar vi service som gör skillnad. Vi erbjuder våra kunder allt från städning till teknisk service, mat- och arbetsplatstjänster. Vi skapar arbetsplatser där människor trivs, företag växer och där hållbarhet är en självklarhet – socialt, miljömässigt och affärsmässigt. Våra medarbetare är hjärtat i det vi gör – och avgörande för att våra kunder ska känna sig trygga, sedda – och för att deras arbetsplatser ska blomstra.
Vill du vara med och skapa trygga, hållbara och välfungerande miljöer för patienter, vårdpersonal och besökare på ett av Europas främsta sjukhus? ISS söker en engagerad och affärsdriven Platschef som med närvarande ledarskap och god struktur säkerställer en professionell och stabil serviceleverans i en komplex och viktig miljö.


**Om rollen**
-------------



Som Platschef på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset Solna har du ett helhetsansvar för ISS leverans inom lokalvård. Du leder ett team med driftledare och medarbetare och ansvarar för att verksamheten bedrivs i enlighet med kundavtal, lagkrav och ISS värderingar. Du har ansvar för personal, arbetsmiljö, bemanning, ekonomi och kundrelation – och driver verksamheten mot uppsatta mål i nära samarbete med både kund och interna funktioner.



Tjänsten kräver ett närvarande och lösningsorienterat ledarskap. Du bygger starka relationer, arbetar strukturerat och bidrar aktivt till att skapa en trygg och professionell miljö för alla som vistas i lokalerna. Vid behov är du beredd att själv stötta i den dagliga driften. Du säkerställer att bemanning och resurser anpassas efter verksamhetens behov och arbetar kontinuerligt med förbättringar.


**Vi erbjuder**
---------------



En spännande och utvecklande roll i ett av världens största tjänsteföretag inom Facility Management. Hos ISS får du tillgång till interna nätverk, utbildningar och karriärmöjligheter. Vår kultur präglas av ansvar, kvalitet, ärlighet och entreprenörsanda. Du blir del av en organisation där samarbete och utveckling står i centrum – både för affären och för våra medarbetare.


**Vem söker vi?**
-----------------



Vi söker dig som är en relationsskapande och kommunikativ ledare med god förmåga att motivera och engagera andra. Du är självgående, strukturerad och har ett starkt intresse för verksamhetsutveckling och kvalitet. Du har tidigare haft ansvar för personal, ekonomi och kundrelationer, och har vana av att arbeta i en personalintensiv serviceverksamhet.



Du uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska, och har goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office och andra vanliga IT-system. Eftergymnasial utbildning är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet från vård- eller omsorgsmiljöer. B-körkort krävs, och kontroll av belastningsregister kan förekomma.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, med inledande provanställning. Du arbetar dagtid, men flexibilitet krävs för att kunna vara tillgänglig för personal och kund.


**Ansökan**
-----------



Vi tillämpar löpande urval och ser gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via mejl. I din ansökan bifogar du CV. Rekryteringsprocessen kan komma att inkludera tester, intervjuer och referenstagning. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Cecilia Palmberg på mejladress cecilia.palmberg@se.issworld.com.



Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Chef lokalvård till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset Huddinge /ISS
description:

Vi erbjuder våra kunder allt från städning till teknisk service, mat- och arbetsplatstjänster. title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


The **Lead Software Engineer** is involved in the specification and development of the product, associated tools and the continuous integration system.
