 The positions are part of the faculty at the Department of Marketing and Strategy and teaching will broadly be within these two subject areas (at bachelor, master and executive levels with English as instruction language). Research and teaching are equally important, and the candidates will be offered support and training in pedagogy. The standard teaching load for tenure track faculty at SSE is four courses per year with the possibility of a 50% reduction through external research grants. Due to generous external funding of the center, the current positions come with a fully reduced teaching load (the equivalent of two courses/year) during the tenure track period. The candidates are expected to engage in collaboration with external stakeholders in both research and teaching, tapping into our wide network of partner organizations.
   

  

 To summarize, we are looking for two junior colleagues with a passion for both research and teaching, who are doing outstanding research, have a track record of high-quality teaching, and come with excellent recommendations. Candidates should be prepared to contribute to our research environment, our education programs, and other areas in the life of a thriving academic institution.
   

  

 The expected start date for the positions is January 2026, but we are open to discussing alternative start dates. Salaries are competitive, commensurate with qualifications and experience, and are set on an individual basis. The tenure track period is 6 years, conditional on successful mid-term review after 3 years. Tenure evaluation takes place after a maximum of 6 years, and successful evaluation leads to conversion of the tenure-track position into a tenured Associate Professor position.
   

  

**Requirements**
 The positions require a PhD within the social sciences or humanities, e.g. business administration, economics, (economic) geography, (economic) history, (economic) psychology, (economic) sociology, philosophy, political science, science and technology studies. Candidates must have completed their PhD prior to taking up the position and must demonstrate a strong research interest in markets and a commitment to high quality research and teaching in relevant areas. Experience from interdisciplinary research is a merit. Preference will be given to candidates who have published in top journals, have a proven track record of international peer-reviewed publications, and/or a strong pipeline of submitted papers. Candidates should have an active presence in the international research community. Reviewing experience from relevant journals is a merit.
   

  

 The candidates should have documented experience from teaching relevant courses and must demonstrate teaching effectiveness as indicated by teaching evaluations, letters of recommendations and/or peer reviews. Experience from teaching at both bachelor and master level, designing courses, coaching student projects, and teaching in executive education are considered merits. Ability to teach across core areas at SSE including the various management disciplines will also be valued.
   

  

 Finally, candidates should demonstrate an ability and willingness to undertake administrative duties and play a full part in the intellectual life of the department and school at large.
   

  

**About The Center For Philosophies Of Markets**
 The Center for Philosophies of Markets at the Stockholm School of Economics is a newly formed interdisciplinary research center that draws on SSEs strong and broad research interest in markets. The Handelsbanken Chair in Philosophies of Markets is tied to the center, whose faculty currently (june 2025) consists of one full professor, two associate professors, one assistant professor, three postdocs and a center director. In addition there are four PhD students whose projects are linked to the center. The long-term ambition is that the center should comprise 8-10 researchers and 4-5 PhD students.
   

  

 The research agenda focuses on questioning and developing theoretical insights about markets, their workings and roles in society. This includes, among other things, understanding the theories and ideas that underpin markets and how these contribute to shape actual markets, studying processes of market formation and change, probing the workings of market societies, examining the growth imperative associated with contemporary markets, and exploring alternative market forms. The center is agnostic to the specific type of markets it studies and will pursue research projects across traditional product and service markets, consumer and producer markets, platform markets, healthcare markets, financial markets, labor markets, etc. The center is methodologically agnostic but has a clear focus on meso-level phenomena including individual markets and market systems.
   

  

**About The Department Of Marketing And Strategy**
 The Department of Marketing and Strategy is one of six academic departments at the Stockholm School of Economics. The department currently consists of 10 full professors, 7 associate professors, 7 assistant professors, 3 lecturers, and 21 PhD students. The department contributes to teaching in the bachelor, master, PhD, MBA and executive education programs at SSE. The department also hosts about 30 affiliated researchers (funded by external research grants).
   

  

 Research at the department covers several disciplines including consumer marketing, strategic management and marketing, international business and marketing, business law, but also economic psychology, economic sociology, economic geography, and economic history. While this means that a variety of theoretical perspectives and research methods are employed, the faculty shares a high-performance research orientation and culture. Faculty members are expected to regularly publish in top journals within their respective fields. Our tenure evaluations reflect this and rely, among other things, on the AJG and FT50 lists as indicators of research quality. Besides publishing, our faculty members also actively and successfully apply for external research grants to fund both their own research and PhD and post doc projects.
   

  

****How to apply****
 The formal application is made via the SSE Varbi online platform ( http://jobs.hhs.se/job-vacancies ). To be considered for the position, please submit:
   

  

* A cover letter articulating your fit with the position description, including research interests and plans, and teaching experience/competence.
* A complete and up-to-date curriculum vitae.
* A separate document listing both published articles (if any), submitted articles (including information about journal and current status), and working papers (including information about targeted journals).
* Copies of representative research.
* Names and contact information for three academic references.


 Your application must be received by
 **September 1, 2025.**

title: Erfaren upphandlare
description:
**Du – erfaren upphandlare, behövs på inköpssektionen hos FOI för att arbeta mot ett säkrare Sverige!**
*Vi är ett trevligt och kunnigt gäng som samarbetar och respekterar varandras kunskaper och då FOI växer behöver vi fler erfarna kollegor. Är du en kompetent och erfaren upphandlare som är redo för nya utmaningar? Vill du bidra i en innovativ och spännande verksamhet i forskningens absoluta framkant inom försvar och säkerhet? Då kan Totalförsvarets forskningsinstitut, FOI, vara en intressant arbetsplats för dig.*
**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som upphandlare kommer du självständigt och tillsammans med kollegor att ansvara för upphandling och inköp av varor och tjänster. Du kommer även att få bidra med dina kunskaper i form av utbildningar samt råd och stöd till organisationens beställare. Då FOI är ett av Europas ledande forskningsinstitut inom försvar och säkerhet har vi ett mycket varierande behov av anskaffningar. Utöver ordinarie arbete med upphandlingar kommer du bland annat även att arbeta med avrop, avtalsuppföljning och förbättringsarbete. Din placering kommer att vara i Kista och resor i tjänsten kan förekomma. Arbetet sker primärt på plats i FOI:s lokaler.
   

  

  

**Har du den kompetensprofil vi behöver?**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning eller annan utbildning i kombination med för rollen aktuell och relevant erfarenhet
* flera års erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling som anställd vid, eller på uppdrag av, upphandlande myndighet eller enhet
* god förmåga att utrycka dig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* mycket goda kunskaper i lagen om offentlig upphandling (LOU)
* erfarenhet av upphandlingsverktyget Mercell TendSign


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* kunskaper i säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585)
* erfarenhet av arbete mot teknik- och IT-styrda beställare


 Som person är du driven och stabil med hög integritet. Du arbetar strukturerat och självständigt men har även god förmåga till samarbete och är tydlig i din kommunikation med kollegor och beställare. Som upphandlare vid FOI värnar du om den goda affären och tillämpar LOU på ett ändamålsenligt sätt. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På FOI bidrar du med din kunskap i en verksamhet som arbetar för ett starkare totalförsvar och samhälle. För dig som upphandlare innebär det bland annat att stödja olika projekt inom t.ex. försvarsteknik och säkerhet med anskaffning av varor och tjänster. Utöver kärnverksamhetens behov ansvarar sektionen för inköp även för övriga anskaffningar inom myndigheten. Ditt arbete på FOI gör att våra uppdragsgivare som till exempel Försvarsmakten och Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap blir effektivare, kunnigare och starkare inom sina respektive områden. FOI erbjuder goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling för att stärka dig i din roll.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i sektionen för inköp som tillhör ekonomienheten. Ekonomienheten ligger under avdelningen forskningsstöd. Sektionen består för närvarande av elva personer; en sektionschef, fem upphandlare, fyra inköpare och en upphandlingsjurist med placering dels i Kista och dels i Linköping. Placeringsort för denna tjänst är Kista.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om vad vi gör: https://www.foi.se/om-foi/organisation/forskningsstod.html.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Vi arbetar medvetet för en hållbar och inkluderande arbetsmiljö med en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Utöver detta erbjuder vi en rad förmåner. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: https://www.foi.se/jobba-hos-oss.html
   

  

  

**Vill du vara med och söka svaren för en säkrare värld?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev via ansökningslänken senast den
   

**11 augusti 2025.**
 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Henrik Ekholm. Fackliga företrädare är Jon Grumer (Saco-S) och Eddie Krusten (OFR/S – ST). Samtliga nås på 08-555 030 00.
   

  

 Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). Inför säkerhetsprövning efterfrågas vidimerade kopior på de utbildningar och tjänstgöringsintyg som är relevanta för tjänsten.
   

  

*Då vi är en myndighet betraktas inlämnade ansökningshandlingar som allmän handling och kan på begäran lämnas ut till utomstående enligt offentlighets- och sekretesslagen.*
 Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag undanbedes.

title: Nordic Price Architect
description:
A unique opportunity to take on the role of Price Architect in the Tryg organization for Denmark, Sweden, and Norway!
   

  

 Tryg’s financial goals require continued innovative insurance technical development, so that Tryg can respond to opportunities and challenges with high speed and accuracy. The established PPU (Portfolio, Price, Product & Underwriting) organization will ensure that Tryg, as a group, utilizes its technical excellence throughout the Nordic region to create an even stronger Tryg. Pricing Excellence is an essential part of Tryg’s Technical Excellence in the Strategy 2027 agenda, which was communicated at our latest Capital Markets Day in London.
   

  

**About the role | Key responsibilities as Price Architect**
 You will, together with another Nordic pricing architect, be our liaison officer and connection point for pricing across Tryg in the Nordics. You will keep track of and secure the enhancement of our technical excellence in pricing across Tryg. You will create collaboration around a common and advanced technical pricing design and, together with the pricing community, set strategic steer and direction for our pricing. You will engage in creating a best practice in pricing across, and be on top of trends and frontier practices in the industry.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Set and follow up on minimum requirements related to Pricing development, competencies, capacity, processes, and content across BUs.
* Create and promote Best Practices in Pricing based on BU internal competencies and external/market inputs.
* Support Business Units in developing strong technical excellence and new ways of working in Pricing.
* Promote and facilitate knowledge sharing and upskilling across BUs in Pricing by promoting and facilitating forums, conferences, and other gatherings
* Investigate pricing frontiers and create a forward-looking view on future pricing and pricing governance. This includes external relations with relevant organizations specializing in pricing practices.
* Analyze and, in collaboration with BUs, set common strategic steer and direction for Pricing and basis for Pricing.
* In collaboration with risk & compliance, set necessary proactive and forward-looking steer for pricing.
* Be system owner for Pricing Tools and act as collector of future demands and cross-functional implementation principles and guidelines.


**About you | Do you have experience in insurance technical and pricing?**
 You have an M.Sc. in business economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related discipline, preferably with a minimum of 5 years’ experience within the insurance technical domain and pricing, preferably in personal and commercial lines, and preferably a couple of years’ experience in leadership roles. You may also have spent a few years working as an actuarial consultant in an international setting.
   

  

 We imagine that you have most of the following competencies and background:
   

  

* Strong analytical and creative mindset
* Strong influential and leadership skills
* Solid collaboration, communication, and stakeholder management skills
* Strong general business skills, including strategy, structure, and process skills
* Insight into IT and data management
* You communicate easily in at least one Scandinavian language and understand all (Danish/Norwegian/Swedish) as well as English, both verbally and in writing


**Location | Where is the role placed geographically?**
 As Price Architect, you will most likely be placed in Stockholm (Sweden); however, Ballerup (Denmark) or Bergen (Norway) could also be an option. Some travel is to be expected (circa one day per month).
   

  

**About us | The Portfolio, Price, Product & Underwriting organization**
 PPU is a center of excellence with strong resources in the technical disciplines and will ensure a clear framework for pricing and other technical areas in all local business units (BU). This includes a number of minimum requirements, which will include a framework for processes and reporting, as well as a fixed structure for cooperation between the business units. Tryg is strengthening group-wide collaboration and finding methods of scaling local initiatives, and PPU is an enabler of collaboration within the insurance technical space.
   

  

 Nordic PPU will ensure that Tryg’s business units work according to common principles and, at the same time, act as a close sparring partner for the business units and thus contribute to becoming even better at working with PPU locally. The central unit is also responsible for ensuring strong capabilities and professional communities around PPU, which will contribute to the exchange of knowledge, professional sparring, development of new ideas, and overall create a better balance between growth, profitability, and stability to meet Tryg’s financial targets.
   

  

**Send us your application!**
 If you see the role as an exciting opportunity and you want to be part of a company with the highest employee satisfaction in the industry, please send your application as soon as possible. We will invite for interviews on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Do you have questions about the role? Please reach out to Christian Schyberg, Head of PPU Excellence, at +46 701 682020.
   

  

**Application deadline: 31 July**
 Final candidates will undergo a background check.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Job Requisition ID: 27508
   

  

 We encourage everyone regardless of gender identity, age, background, disability or origin to apply for the position. We are proud to have high employee satisfaction, strong professionalism and equal opportunities to develop your career in the Tryg Group. Tryg is the largest non-life insurance company in Scandinavia with activities in Denmark, Norway and Sweden. Every day we strive – each in our own way – to create peace of mind and affect the lives of most Scandinavians. Read more at www.tryg.com

title: SAP FICO Solution Architect
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
**Shape the future of finance at Scania.**
 We’re looking for a seasoned SAP FICO Solution Architect to join our SAP Center of Excellence. This is a key role in our S/4HANA greenfield implementation — a once-in-a-generation transformation of Scania’s digital finance landscape.
   

  

 As a strategic advisor and hands-on architect, you’ll lead the design of scalable, integrated SAP FICO solutions that support our global operations. You’ll collaborate across business and IT to ensure our financial systems are future-ready, robust, and aligned with best practices.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Architect and implement end-to-end SAP FICO solutions within the S/4HANA greenfield program.
* Ensure seamless integration with legacy and non-SAP systems.
* Define and enforce best practices across FICO modules: GL, AP, AR, AA, Material & Inventory Accounting, and Controlling.
* Lead full lifecycle activities: blueprinting, gap analysis, configuration, testing, cutover, and training.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
* Provide expert guidance on enhancements, new functionalities, and process optimization.
* Mentor junior colleagues and support stakeholder alignment.
* Drive adoption of SAP innovations and ensure alignment with Scania’s IT strategy.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 10+ years of SAP FICO experience, including 5+ years as a Solution Architect.
* Proven track record in at least 2 full-cycle SAP implementations.
* Hands-on experience with S/4HANA (greenfield preferred).
* Strong understanding of integration points across SAP and non-SAP systems.
* Deep knowledge of financial processes and technical configuration.
* Experience in the automotive or manufacturing industry is a strong plus.
* Familiarity with Central Finance, VIM, Blackline, SAC, and SAP Activate is advantageous.
* Agile mindset and experience with tools like JIRA.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* SAP certifications are a plus.


**Who You Are**
 You are a strategic and hands-on SAP FICO expert with a strong business mindset and a passion for digital transformation. With your deep knowledge of financial processes and cross-functional integration, you confidently lead complex initiatives and drive change in dynamic environments. You are a collaborative partner, eager to mentor others and align business needs with scalable SAP solutions, while always keeping best practices and long-term value in focus
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We are the SAP Center of Excellence within Scania IT, now integrated with the ERP Digital Core section. Our team is at the forefront of Scania’s digital transformation, driving SAP initiatives across finance, logistics, and supply chain. We work cross-functionally in a collaborative and agile setting, combining deep technical expertise with business insight to design scalable solutions.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-08. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Annasaheb More (Group Manager), annasaheb.more@scania.com
   

  

 Please note that due to the summer vacation period, responses to questions may take a bit longer than usual.
   

  

**We look forward for your application!**

title: Multidisciplinär projektledare för autonom produktion och logistik!
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi är specialister inom industriell automation och söker nu fler medarbetare till vår satsning i Nynäshamn. På AFRY Advanced Automation arbetar vi med spännande och teknikintensiva uppdrag där vi levererar skräddarsydda lösningar inom autonom produktion och logistik till kunder inom både den privata och offentliga sektorn.
   

  

 Som projektledare hos AFRY kommer du att ha en central roll i att driva stora och innovativt tekniskt komplexa projekt där flera discipliner inom industrisektorn samverkar. Du ansvarar för både våra interna leveranser och för att samordna externa projekt, med målet att säkerställa att projekten genomförs enligt avtal, budget och tidsplan. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med våra kunder, där du med ett pragmatiskt och affärsmässigt förhållningssätt navigerar i förhandlingar och bygger långsiktiga relationer. Du representerar AFRYs intressen i projekt och du är trygg i att hantera dessa sammanhang med professionalism och tydlighet.
   

  

 Vår erfarenhet inom industrin ger oss en stark plattform att stå på – samtidigt ser vi hur fler branscher, som exempelvis sjukvård och logistik, utvecklas i en riktning där industriella lösningar blir allt mer relevanta. Som projektledare hos oss får du därför möjlighet att arbeta i en bredd av projekt, även inom nya och växande områden där vår tekniska kompetens kan bidra till verklig förändring.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är det avgörande att vara en lagspelare. Du trivs med att samarbeta tätt med både interna team och externa parter, och ser värdet i att bygga starka relationer för att nå gemensamma mål. Genom ett öppet och lösningsorienterat arbetssätt bidrar du till en positiv projektkultur där samverkan står i centrum.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du leder projekt både inom Sverige och Norden, men det kan även förekomma uppdrag utanför dessa gränser. Arbetet utförs främst från vårt kontor i Nynäshamn, men resor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Bakgrund inom industrin och automation, alternativt från närliggande områden som, automotive eller industriell IT/Digitalisering.
* Förståelse för industriprocesser och tekniska system.
* Förmåga att sätta dig in i och hantera stora affärsavtal.
* En pragmatisk och affärsorienterad personlighet – du är trygg i förhandlingar och har lätt för att bygga långsiktiga relationer.
* B-körkort då resor i tjänsten förekommer.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


 Vidare har du har en god förmåga att navigera i komplexa organisationer och projektmiljöer, där olika intressen och perspektiv behöver balanseras på ett diplomatiskt och strategiskt sätt.
   

  

 Vi tror att du som dessutom har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda multidisciplinära projekt hade platsat extra väl i rollen. En examen som civilingenjör är meriterande.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
**Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-09-30.** 
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 För frågor gällande tjänsten, kontakta mig!
   

  

 Anna Rydäng
   

  

 anna.rydang@afry.com
   

  

 +46 10 505 65 11
   

  

 Den här rekryteringen sköts internt av oss på AFRY och vi undanber oss vänligen kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Account Manager till Inregos Internationella säljavdelning
description:
**Vill du göra skillnad på riktigt och ta din karriär till nästa nivå inom hållbar försäljning? Är du social, orädd och nyfiken på nya människor? Har du ett intresse för teknik och trivs med att kommunicera över telefon?** 




  





 Som
 **Account Manager** 
 på vår internationella säljavdelning får du en unik möjlighet att bygga långsiktiga affärsrelationer över hela världen och bidra till en mer hållbar IT-bransch. I rollen kommer du att arbeta med försäljning av rekonditionerad IT-utrustning till kunder i över 90 länder.
 **För att lyckas hos oss tror vi att du har ett tekniskt intresse, gillar att ta initiativ och trivs i en roll där du dagligen har kontakt med nya och befintliga kunder via telefon.** 




  





 Vår internationella avdelning består för närvarande av 8 personer från 8 olika nationaliteter, som talar 8 olika språk, med ett åldersspann på 25–45 år.
 



 Till en början kommer ditt arbete i stor utsträckning handla om att skaffa nya kunder på både nya och befintliga marknader. Det långsiktiga målet är att hantera cirka 20–30 konton med en omsättning på 3,5–4 miljoner euro per år.
 



  





 Du kommer att vara en del av ett erfaret team som är marknadsledande, och som ny Account Manager tilldelas du en sponsor som stöttar och ger råd under den inledande perioden. Vårt team arbetar från vårt kontor i Täby, Sverige, tre dagar i veckan.
 



  





**Din profil:** 



* Kunskap om datorhårdvara, exempelvis vad HDD, RAM och SSD är
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Excel
* Grundkunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt och prioritera effektivt
* Känsla för kundens behov och en vilja att hjälpa



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Tidigare vana av att ringa många telefonsamtal
* Erfarenhet av datorer. Exempelvis byggt en egen dator
* Annat språk än svenska eller engelska



  





**Övrig information:** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi gör uppehåll under semestertider och återupptar rekryteringsarbetet i början av augusti.
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  





 Låter detta som en passande tjänst för dig? Då är du varmt välkommen att skicka en ansökan till oss.
 



  





 Since 1995, Inrego has been at the center of the circular economy. Our experience has made us experts in reuse of IT.
 



 Being part of Inrego means being part of our vision and the higher purpose that we are working towards. Together, we are changing the worlds IT consumption to become sustainable. Our business concept is to offer organizations the IT solutions of the future through reuse and sustainable services.
 



 Inrego is a privately owned company with clear values and a corporate culture characterized by constant development, openness and innovative thinking. Our values are: Upstanding, Happy Eyes, Big Heart and Strong Will. Our employees describe us as an entrepreneurial company with a can-do mentality, where helpfulness, willingness to change and being solution-oriented are important qualities to thrive with us.
 



 Today we are 170 employees with offices in Täby, Stockholm and Vantaa, Helsinki.

title: BANQUET CHEF
description:
**About TAK**
 Located at the top of Brunkebergstorg, Modern Scandinavian cuisine, influenced by Japanese cooking techniques and flavors. Complex creations that are easy to love. We use locally sourced ingredients carefully selected according to the season. With genuine craftsmanship in every detail, we aim to create a dining experience beyond the ordinary.
   

  

 TAK has restaurants and bars across two floors, focusing on Swedish and Nordic ingredients, combined with techniques and flavors from Japan.
   

  

 At TAK, we strive to take our guests on a memorable journey through the Nordic-Japanese kitchen. With exceptional hospitality, we create unique experiences in our stunning venue. With a strong focus on details and true craftsmanship, we guide every guest with heartfelt and inclusive service at the highest level.
   

  

 At TAK, we live by our core values:
 **Professional, Passionate, and Playful** 
 . Together with all our employees, we aim to create an environment unlike any other – a place you will love being in, feel a deep passion for, and, most importantly, be inspired to do your very best to ensure our guests have an unforgettable experience.
   

  

**Why Join TAK?**
 At TAK, we take pride in pushing the boundaries of creativity and hospitality. Our restaurant is more than just a space for food and drinks - it’s a stage for artistry and innovation. If you’re passionate about food and beverages, service, and elevating the guest experience, we invite you to join our dynamic team.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are seeking a skilled and passionate Banquet chef to join our talented kitchen team at TAK. As Banquet chef you will be the face of our kitchen, delivering exceptional service while showcasing a deep knowledge of cooking skills and food preparations. You will play an essential role in creating unforgettable moments for our guests.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Craft exceptional food: Create and plate high-quality dishes and menus, showing TAK’s gastronomy.
* Expertise in cooking: Maintain an in-depth knowledge of different produce and flavors.
* Deliver outstanding Service: Provide professional, attentive, and personalized service, ensuring guest satisfaction at all times.
* Maintain standards: Ensure cleanliness, organization, and efficiency in all kitchen operations, adhering to health and safety standards.
* Ownership: Taking full responsibility regarding planning menu's and orders.


**Requirements**
 We are looking for a Banquet chef who brings passion, creativity, and professionalism to every shift and meals you create. Candidates must meet the following criteria:
   

  

* Proven experience: Minimum 7 years of experience in high-end kitchens and/or catering kitchens with a focus on premium service and standards.
* Gastronomy knowledge: Documented deep knowledge in food preparations, kitchen techniques and an eagerness to continuously learn and innovate.
* Attention to detail: Ability to consistently deliver high standards in preparation, service and presentation.
* Exceptional communication skills: Confident, clear, and professional interactions with client and team members.
* Work ethic: Reliable, punctual, and committed to exceeding expectations.
* Passion for Hospitality: A genuine enthusiasm for creating memorable guest experiences.


**We Offer**
 As a Full-time Employee At TAK, You Will Also Be Part Of Nordic Hotels & Resorts, Which Comes With Several Perks, Including
   

  

* Healthcare benefits and access to a gym at our sister hotels
* Four complimentary hotel nights per year at any hotel within our chain
* Employee discounts at all restaurants within the group (Strawberry Hotels)
* Employee rates at all hotels within the group (Strawberry Hotels)
* Opportunity to be part of an exciting and expanding restaurant
* Competitive salary
* Career development opportunities


**Employment Type**
* This position is available full-time
* Availability: As soon as possible
* Daytime shifts from Monday until Friday (6:00-14:30)
* Always off on weekends


**Ready to Elevate Your Career?**
 If you meet these requirements and are ready to take your career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply below and become a vital part of TAK’s journey to redefine dining excellence!
   

  

 Don’t hesitate to send our Head Chef, Hyun Desimpelaere an email at hyun.desimpelaere@tak.se if you have any questions.
   

  

*We are proud members of Nordic Hotels & Resorts – a collection of hotels and resorts for guests seeking unique experiences, whether for business or leisure. Each hotel and restaurant strives for a distinct, independent profile with a strong and recognizable identity.*
*Today, Nordic Hotels & Resorts consists of 40+ hotels and resorts, and we continue to grow. What unites all our hotels is a commitment to offering extraordinary guest experienc* 
 es—always beyond the ordinary.

title: Automationsingenjör SCADA - Aveva System Platform
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Hos AFRY Advanced Automation i Mälardalen händer det nu mycket spännande. Vi är specialister inom el, automation, programmering och digitalisering inom både större samt mindre projekt. Vi jobbar mot en mängd olika kunder, både inom den offentliga och den privata sektorn. Vi gör nu en uttalad satsning mot att utöka vår verksamhet i regionen och har redan vunnit flera stora projekt som vi är i uppstartsfasen för!
   

  

 Vi vill nu utöka vår verksamhet och stärka upp våra team med kompetens kring Avevas System Platform då vi under året vunnit flera nya projekt och stärkt vår roll på marknaden som integratör och rådgivare avseende systemet.
   

  

 Rollen som Avevaingenjör är mångfacetterad, vilket innebär att dina arbetsuppgifter kommer variera över tid beroende på din kompetens, kundens behov samt din personliga ambition och utveckling. Du får möjlighet att skräddarsy din roll, men i stora drag så kommer den innebära att samordna och leda arbetet i större projekt gällande AVEVAs projekteringsverktyg, arbete med kataloger och specifikationer, programmering i PML och C#. Även administration i databaser och datamodeller, strukturering och automatisering av ritningsproduktion samt att bidra till utvecklingen internt och i det också arbeta med framtagandet av effektiva arbetsprocesser.
   

  

 Sektionen består idag av ca 20 kollegor som gärna hittar på roliga saker tillsammans. Hos oss är du en del av ett lag som arbetar från idéstadie till avslutat projekt och färdig anläggning inom industri. Du kan förvänta dig en organisation som satsar på leveranser inom digitalisering/automation och en möjlighet att få växa inom AFRY där du får stor chans att utveckla dig.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att lyckas i rollen så tror vi att du är en självgående person med god vana att arbeta och prestera i projektbaserade team. På AFRY värdesätter vi ett gott affärsmässigt förhållningssätt då våra kontaktytor bygger på samarbete och goda relationer. Då vi ställs inför komplexa tekniska problem så tror vi att du har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt, utöver det så känner du igen dig i kravprofilen nedan:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av AVEVA System Platform (tidigare Wonderware)
* Erfarenhet av IoT och OT
* Relevant ingenjörsutbildning inom Data, IT, Systemvetenskap eller likvärdigt
* B-körkort då det kan förekomma resor i tjänsten.
* Kan kommunicera mycket väl på både svenska och engelska.


 Meriterande är om du har certifiering i någon CTP AVEVA-plattform.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Välkommen med din ansökan,
 **sista ansökningsdag är 2025-09-30.** 
 På grund av semestertider kan återkoppling dröja längre än vanligt.
   

  

**Kontaktperson för frågor:**
 Nico Hengst, Rekryteringsansvarig
   

  

 Nico.hengst@afry.com
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Team Lead Software Engineering II (m/f/d)
description:
**YOUR JOB**


Are you looking for a senior individual contributor role where your code and your leadership make an impact every day? Are you excited to lead from the front, driving the successful delivery of product features in an Agile environment? Are you ready to shape the next phase of DataGuard? Then this role is for you.

**LET’S PROTECT THE PEOPLE BEHIND THE DATA**


We are a fast-growing security and compliance tech company with a clear purpose: we protect the people behind the data. With over 250 team members worldwide and offices in Munich, Berlin, London, Stockholm, and Vienna, we help more than 4,000 global customers get certified fast and build a strong and scalable risk posture. With AI-powered automation, self-serve capabilities, and additional tailored expert advice, we offer our customers a seamless security and compliance experience to stay ahead of the rapidly evolving security landscape and challenges like the surge in cyber-attacks.

**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**

* You will step into a senior individual contributor role where you blend deep technical expertise with team leadership to drive the successful delivery of product features in an Agile environment.
* You will provide architectural guidance, define coding standards, and champion best practices for scalable, maintainable, high-performance systems.
* You will facilitate Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives - keeping the team focused and aligned.
* You will partner with cross-functional stakeholders across Product, Design, Architecture, DevOps, AI, and QA to align priorities and trade-offs.
* You will actively contribute to the codebase and take on complex engineering challenges - leading by example with clean, efficient, and testable code.
* You will own and promote CI/CD pipelines, observability standards, and incident management for production readiness.
* You will identify workflow inefficiencies and champion improvements to boost developer experience and team velocity.
* You will promote a culture of ownership, psychological safety, and continuous improvement, serving as a team catalyst.

**WHAT YOU’LL GET IN RETURN**

* The proper tools and capacities to build up and work with an ambitious international team with diverse skill sets
* Enjoy the freedom and trust to bring in and execute your ideas with a quick pace, autonomy, and the ability to make impactful decisions.
* Gain strategic insights into management topics with the opportunity to actively contribute, working closely alongside leadership and executive peers.
* Rapid development opportunities, attractive performance bonuses, and the opportunity to strengthen your leadership skills and business expertise
* Step into a stable, forward-looking role within a dynamic scale-up poised to shape the fast-growing Security & Compliance industry

**WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO STRIVE IN YOUR NEW POSITION**

* At least 8 years of web development as a full-stack developer
* At least 2 years of experience as a technical leader
* Strong foundation as a full-stack engineer
* Deep understanding of server-side technologies and distributed systems
* We are primarily focused on JavaScript/React/Vue.js for the frontend and Java for the backend. Experience with any of these or similar technologies is helpful: Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Git, and Continuous Integration (GitLab CI).
* Desire to work at a startup with a fast-paced environment and experience with Agile methodologies
* Fluency in English Language (German is a plus)
* A university degree in Computer Science or a similar educational background is a plus

**LAST BUT NOT LEAST. FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS:**

No matter your origin, ethnicity, gender identity, religion, or individual requirements, at DataGuard, all that counts is the person you are. As Guards and Guardettes, we are united not only by our dedication but also by our shared belief in our purpose: Protect the people behind the data. Convince us with your personality and your skills, and together we will make great things happen. We are looking forward to meeting you!
company_description: WE PROTECT THE PEOPLE BEHIND THE DATA

title: Senior Delivery Manager
description:
**iGaming:**  

If it’s iGaming, we know a thing or two. At Light & Wonder, It’s all about the games, and our digital team leads the global iGaming market, providing jaw-dropping content and innovative software that powers the world's most successful online gaming providers.


**Position Summary**

**Light & Wonder** is the global leader in cross-platform games and entertainment. The company brings together 5,000 employees from six continents to connect content between land-based and digital channels with unmatched technology and distribution. Guided by a culture that values daring teamwork and creativity, Light & Wonder builds new worlds of play, developing game experiences loved by players around the globe. The company’s Infinity platform powers the largest digital-gaming network in the industry. Light & Wonder is committed to the highest standards of integrity, from promoting player responsibility to implementing sustainable practices. **To learn more, visit lnw.com.**

**Role Summary**
----------------

We are seeking a highly experienced **Senior Delivery Manager** to lead the successful delivery of complex, multi-workstream iGaming projects for one of our most strategic clients. Based in Sweden, this role is pivotal in driving operational excellence, stakeholder satisfaction, and long-term partnership value. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years’ experience in delivery roles, preferably within the iGaming industry, and possess deep knowledge of managing enterprise-level clients and intricate delivery landscapes.


**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Own end-to-end delivery for a high-value, high-complexity program of work, ensuring alignment with client expectations, timelines, and commercial objectives.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for all delivery-related matters with the customer.
* Lead cross-functional teams across Product, Engineering, QA, DevOps, and TechOps to drive successful outcomes.
* Create and manage delivery plans, ensuring tracking of milestones, risks, and dependencies across multiple parallel workstreams.
* Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with client stakeholders at senior and executive levels.
* Manage client escalations, resolving delivery challenges with a solutions-focused, collaborative approach.
* Ensure governance processes are followed, including reporting, change control, and steering committee participation.
* Identify and mitigate risks proactively; escalate critical issues to leadership with well-structured context and recommendations.
* Continuously seek opportunities to enhance delivery efficiency and customer satisfaction.

**Qualifications**

**Experience & Skills**

* 5-7+ years’ experience in delivery or project/program management roles within technology or software development environments.
* Proven track record managing complex client engagements in high-pressure, high-value environments.
* Deep experience in the iGaming sector, particularly with B2B casino platforms and/or operators (strongly preferred).
* Demonstrated ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams and coordinate across multiple concurrent projects.
* Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.
* Strong commercial awareness and understanding of contract delivery terms, scope, SLAs, and change control.
* Experience with delivery tooling and practices such as Jira, Confluence, Monday.com, MS Project/ Agile/Scrum and Kanban methodologies.
* Relevant project management certifications such as **PMP** , **PRINCE2** , or **Scrum Master (CSM/PSM)** are highly desirable.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken); Finnish language skills are a plus.

**Key Attributes**
------------------

* Strategic thinker with hands-on execution ability.
* Calm under pressure and highly organised.
* Customer-obsessed, relationship-oriented mindset.
* Strong leadership presence with the ability to drive accountability.
* Analytical, pragmatic, and solution-oriented.

#LI-Hybrid


#LI-iGaming

title: DevOps Engineer – Azure Services med inriktning på Integration
description:
**Category:** Project Management
**Main location:** Sweden, Skåne , Malmö
**Position ID:** J0625-1426
**Employment Type:** Full Time
**Position Description:**
-------------------------


Vill du vara med och driva den digitala transformationen inom integrationstjänster?  

Hos CGI får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett av världens största IT- och affärskonsultföretag, där innovation, samarbete och kundnytta står i fokus. Vi söker nu en DevOps Engineer med expertis inom Azure och integrationslösningar – en nyckelroll i vårt växande team!  

Din roll hos oss  

Som DevOps Engineer hos CGI kommer du att arbeta i gränslandet mellan utveckling och drift med fokus på Azure-miljöer och integrationslösningar. Du är med och designar, implementerar och automatiserar moderna integrationsplattformar hos några av Sveriges mest spännande kunder.


**Your future duties and responsibilities:**
--------------------------------------------


Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar bland annat:  

* Utveckla och förvalta CI/CD-pipelines i Azure DevOps
* Automatisera infrastrukturlösningar (IaC) med t.ex. Bicep eller Terraform
* Säkra och övervaka molnbaserade integrationslösningar (API Management, Logic Apps, Service Bus)
* Samarbeta tätt med utvecklare, arkitekter och projektledare
* Arbeta agilt med moderna metoder som Scrum och SAFe

**Required qualifications to be successful in this role:**
----------------------------------------------------------


Vi söker dig som har:  

* Erfarenhet av DevOps-arbete i Azure-miljöer
* Djup kunskap inom minst några av följande: Azure Integration Services (Logic Apps, API Management, Event Grid, Service Bus)
* God förståelse för CI/CD, automatisering och infrastruktur som kod
* Erfarenhet av containerisering och orkestrering (ex. Docker, Kubernetes)
* Kunskaper i PowerShell, Bash, eller andra script-språk
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


  

Det är meriterande om du har:  

* Certifiering inom Microsoft Azure (ex. AZ-400, AZ-204 eller AZ-305)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete i större organisationer eller offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av hybridlösningar eller migrering från on-prem till moln


Vad erbjuder CGI dig?  

* En trygg anställning i ett stabilt och globalt företag
* Flexibla arbetsformer och möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Personlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och interna karriärvägar
* Delägarskap via vårt aktieprogram
* Engagerade och hjälpsamma kollegor i ett kompetent team

  

Har du några frågor eller funderingar är du varmt välkommen att kotakta Martin Årsköld på Martin.Arskold@cgi.com. Vi ser fram emot in ansökan!  

  

#LI-HW1
**What you can expect from us:**
--------------------------------


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**  

  

Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.  

  

Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.  

  

Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.  

  

Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
  

  

Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Kubernetes Engineer
description:
Vi söker nu en Kubernetes Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.


Som Kubernetes Engineer blir du en viktig del av vårt plattforms- och driftteam, med fokus på att etablera och vidareutveckla vår Kubernetes-baserade infrastruktur. Du ansvarar för att plattformen är robust, säker och optimerad för moderna applikationer, med fokus på både stabil drift och framtida skalbarhet. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam, infrastruktur och säkerhetsfunktioner, och är involverad i allt från design och implementation till övervakning, felsökning och förbättringar.

**Vem är du**  

Du är en tekniskt driven person med erfarenhet av containerbaserad infrastruktur och ett starkt intresse för att bygga stabila, säkra och automatiserade plattformar. Du trivs i komplexa IT-miljöer där höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och prestanda är en självklar del av vardagen.


Vi tror att du har god erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes i produktion, samt vana vid verktyg för Infrastructure as Code såsom Ansible och Terraform. Du har också kunskap om CI/CD och containertekniker som Docker, samt en god förståelse för säkerhet, övervakning och loggning i distribuerade system. Erfarenhet av samarbete mellan drift och utveckling, i en DevOps-kultur, ser vi som en självklarhet.

**Mer information och ansökan**  

I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.  

  

Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Requirements** 




**What will you be bringing to the team?** 



* Bachelor's in Computer Science, Software Engineering, DevOps, or a related technical discipline.
* A minimum of 5-8+ years of progressive experience in a hands-on technical role, with a significant focus on observability, monitoring, or DevOps.
* Minimum of 3-5 years of dedicated experience in designing, implementing, and managing observability solutions in production environments.
* Proven track record of architecting and delivering scalable and resilient observability platforms.
* Extensive experience with incident response and post-mortem analysis.
* Expert-level understanding of Observability Principles: Deep knowledge of the "three pillars" (metrics, logs, traces), distributed tracing, event correlation, and their application in complex systems.
* Deep Hands-on Expertise with Observability Tools: Proven proficiency in deploying, configuring, and optimizing multiple leading observability platforms (e.g., Prometheus/Grafana, ELK Stack, Jaeger/ OpenTelemetry.
* Cloud-Native & Distributed Systems Expertise: In-depth understanding and hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), service mesh, and microservices architectures.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Proficient in using tools like Terraform for automating infrastructure provisioning and configuration related to observability.
* Linux System Administration & Networking: Strong grasp of Linux operating systems, networking protocols, and system-level troubleshooting.
* Database Knowledge: Familiarity with time-series databases (e.g. Prometheus, InfluxDB) and other relevant data stores for observability data.
* Troubleshooting & Root Cause Analysis: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a systematic approach to diagnosing complex technical issues.
* Relevant industry certifications in cloud platforms, Kubernetes, or specific observability tools are highly valued.
* A strong command of the English language is mandatory (speaking, writing)



  





**Thank you very much!**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer** 




  





 My European client is seeking a DevOps Engineer with strong knowledge of Observability for a contract assignment in Stockholm, Sweden. This is a hybrid working model with onsite and offsite working, mainly offsite. Due to the nature of the project, candidates need to be EU citizens and preference will be given to candidates with previous experience in EU institutions.
 



  





**What will your duties as a specialist DevOps Engineer be ?** 




  




* **Observability Platform Design & Architecture:**
* You will design and implement scalable and robust observability architectures for complex distributed systems, including microservices, cloud-native environments (Kubernetes, serverless), and traditional infrastructure.
* You will define and enforce standards and best practices for telemetry data (metrics, logs, traces) collection, processing, storage, and visualization.
* You will also evaluate, select, and integrate new observability tools and technologies into the existing ecosystem.
* **Instrumentation & Data Collection:**
* You will be working directly with development and Back Office teams to implement pervasive instrumentation within applications and infrastructure, using frameworks like OpenTelemetry.
* You will develop custom exporters, agents, or integrations to collect specific telemetry data from various sources.
* You will also configure and optimize data pipelines for efficient ingestion and routing of metrics, logs, and traces.
* **Tooling Implementation & Management:**
* Involved in hands-on deployment, configuration, and administration of observability platforms.
* Support the automation of the deployment and management of observability infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (e.g. Terraform).
* Develop custom dashboards, alerts, and reports to provide actionable insights into system health and performance.
* **Performance Analysis & Troubleshooting:**
* You will support and coach teams for them to identify performance bottlenecks, anomalies, and potential issues by analysing observability data.
* Support and coach teams for them to leverage observability tools to quickly pinpoint root causes and facilitate rapid resolution.
* Support and coach teams for them to conduct in-depth performance analysis, capacity planning, and resource optimization based on collected telemetry.
* Support and coach teams for them to implement anomaly detection and predictive analytics to anticipate and prevent issues.
* **Automation & Scripting:**
* You will need to develop scripts and automation tools to streamline observability workflows, integrate systems, and enhance operational efficiency.
* **Mentoring & Knowledge Sharing:**
* You will act as a subject matter expert, providing technical guidance and mentorship to teams on observability best practices, tools, and troubleshooting techniques.
* Create detailed technical documentation, runbooks, and playbooks.
* Conduct training sessions and workshops to upskill development and operations teams on observability concepts and tools.
* **Collaboration & Cross-functional Support:**
* You'll be in close collaboration with development and operations to embed observability throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
* Work with stakeholders to define Service Level Indicators (SLIs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and build dashboards to track adherence.



  





**Required Skills and Experience** 




  




* Bachelor's in Computer Science, Software Engineering, DevOps, or a related technical discipline.
* A minimum of 5-8+ years of progressive experience in a hands-on technical role, with a significant focus on observability, monitoring, or DevOps.
* Minimum of 3-5 years of dedicated experience in designing, implementing, and managing observability solutions in production environments.
* Proven track record of architecting and delivering scalable and resilient observability platforms.
* Extensive experience with incident response and post-mortem analysis.
* Expert-level understanding of Observability Principles: Deep knowledge of the "three pillars" (metrics, logs, traces), distributed tracing, event correlation, and their application in complex systems.
* Deep Hands-on Expertise with Observability Tools: Proven proficiency in deploying, configuring, and optimizing multiple leading observability platforms (e.g., Prometheus/Grafana, ELK Stack, Jaeger/ OpenTelemetry.
* Cloud-Native & Distributed Systems Expertise: In-depth understanding and hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), service mesh, and microservices architectures.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Proficient in using tools like Terraform for automating infrastructure provisioning and configuration related to observability.
* Linux System Administration & Networking: Strong grasp of Linux operating systems, networking protocols, and system-level troubleshooting.
* Database Knowledge: Familiarity with time-series databases (e.g. Prometheus, InfluxDB) and other relevant data stores for observability data.
* Troubleshooting & Root Cause Analysis: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a systematic approach to diagnosing complex technical issues.
* Relevant industry certifications in cloud platforms, Kubernetes, or specific observability tools are highly valued.
* A strong command of the English language is mandatory (speaking, writing)

title: Data Engineer med fokus på skalbara pipelines och DevOps
description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and lead the development of AI/ML software products and solutions. The primary focus of this role will be to explore large datasets, perform feature engineering, build data pipelines, test and evaluate model outputs, deploy solutions for production, and scale them to ensure maintainability within a complex network.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data infrastructure needed for AI/ML projects.
* Build and implement AI/ML solutions by exploring large datasets, performing feature engineering, and creating data pipelines.
* Ensure that solutions are well-designed, scalable, and maintainable in a production environment.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical roadmap planning, writing scalable, maintainable, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions for common needs in AI/ML projects such as feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B testing, versioning, and serving both online and batch inference endpoints.
* Collaborate with a cross-functional, agile team of engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to build an AI ecosystem.
* Ensure product quality, cybersecurity, and performance requirements are met throughout the development lifecycle.


**Required Skills And Experience**
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* At least 5 years of professional experience in a senior-level Machine Learning Engineer role, preferably in supply chain and demand forecasting domains.
* Strong software engineering skills with hands-on experience in coding and applying software engineering practices, including DevOps, testing, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles to machine learning and AI projects.
* Proven experience in developing and deploying software products to production and scaling them within a large organization.
* Extensive experience with Python programming (4+ years), especially in developing backend services, and familiarity with frameworks like FastAPI.
* Hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development, particularly Google Cloud Platform, including Vertex AI.
* Solid experience in MLOps, building ML pipelines, data pipelines, and deploying machine learning models to production.
* A strong foundational background in data science and practical experience with a variety of AI/ML techniques and frameworks.
* Experience in handling high-volume heterogeneous data (batch and stream), including hands-on development with SQL and DBT.
* Strong understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality management.
* Proven ability to analyze and align requirements, drive solution design, break down tasks, and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
* Experience working in agile environments, fostering collaboration, and supporting team members to adhere to organizational standards and best practices.


 This is an exciting opportunity for a driven, hands-on individual passionate about leveraging their software engineering expertise to build and scale AI/ML solutions in a dynamic and growing organization. If you thrive in fast-paced, data-driven environments and have a strong background in cloud technologies, machine learning, and software engineering, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.
