title: Senior Solutions Architect, Generative AI, Startups, AWS
description:
- Experience with building, validating and deploying GenAI models and applications on cloud infrastructure.
- Sound knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, with working knowledge of frameworks such as Pytorch, TensorFlow, JAX or MXNet.
- Knowledge of MLOps tools and workflows for model development, validation, and deployment.
- High level of communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, with both technical and non-technical audiences.
- Fluent written and verbal communications skills in Swedish and English with demonstrated ability to communicate technical choices to business and technology stakeholders.
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
Trusted by more startups around the world, AWS makes the power of cloud computing accessible for all by giving founders everywhere access to the same technology that powers the world’s largest companies. With nearly 20 years of experience gained from supporting hundreds of thousands of startups that have come before, we help founders prove that their world-changing ideas are possible, at any stage of growth or level of funding. This is why more startups, and over 80% of unicorns, build on AWS.
Startup Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with startups of different stages. Supporting the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS, they work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. Solutions Architects also have broader impact at scale, taking a supporting role in creating and presenting technical content and best practices.
In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to refine cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will be learning something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.
You will be part of a team that is responsible for driving adoption of AWS technologies while bringing differentiated value to customers. This is a team dedicated to Startups, an important and growing subset of customers for AWS. Startups follow unique technology adoption patterns and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses, so you will be employing engagement strategies and programs tailored to their business needs and technical preferences.
Key job responsibilities
\* As a Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers to accelerate their challenging projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes.
\* You operate as a trusted advisor for startups. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide. You work backwards from their priorities and find inventive ways to add value with solutions utilizing AWS and its Partners’ technology.
\* You capture and share the voice of the customer to influence the roadmap of new features and services for AWS. You use your customer understanding to participate in the creation or updates of technical content and reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
\* Evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
To be successful in this role you need to be passionate about startups and cloud architectures. You are a builder with genuine curiosity about how technology can support your customers’ business models and objectives. You are a lifetime learner that develops areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes. You are prepared to work in a fast-paced environment, where you will be positively challenged and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.
A day in the life
The Solutions Architect team at AWS is responsible for helping customers successfully implement cloud technologies. In a typical week you will meet multiple customers and you will collaborate with them on designing and operating well-architected solutions. You will earn their trust and show them the art of the possible, educating them around the capabilities of AWS. Partnering with internal teams and experts, leveraging a deep knowledge of our tools and products, you’ll craft highly-scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that address our customers’ business problems. As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to continuously learn and innovate daily.
The startup organization at AWS comprises experts from across the global ecosystem, including former founders and CTOs, venture capitalists, angel investors, and mentors who upskill today's founders to navigate challenges and opportunities as they build their business, and our Startup Solutions Architect team is where the magic happens. is dedicated to working with startup companies as they build and scale their businesses. We’re here to make sure that they can deploy the best, most scalable, and most secure architectures possible – and that they spend as little time and money as possible doing so. We are a group of technologists with varied backgrounds; from fresh graduates to ex-CTOs, all growing our skills and startup expertise, while working on cutting edge technology use-cases with some of the world’s most innovative companies. For Solutions Architect who like to invent, there's no better place to build than on the AWS Startup SA team.
About the team
Diverse Experiences 
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS? 
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance 
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
Inclusive Team Culture 
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  

* Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS and/or AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional)
* Hands-on experience benchmarking and optimizing performance of models on accelerated computing (GPU, TPU, AI ASICs) clusters with high-speed networking.
* Understanding of technical details and techniques used in tuning generative AI foundation models using techniques like RAG, PEFT, RLHF, DPO
* Experience scaling model training and inference using technologies like Slurm, ParallelCluster, Amazon SageMaker
* Experience in developing and deploying large scale machine learning or deep learning models and/or systems into production, including batch and real-time data processing

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Director - Data & AI
description:
**Adeptis Group is currently recruiting for a Director – AI & Data Consulting** 




 Our client is a global leader in professional services, renowned for driving large-scale digital transformation across a wide range of industries. With a reputation for innovation, they offer the opportunity to work on high-impact projects that shape the future of business and technology. Known for their collaborative culture and investment in employee development, this is an ideal environment for ambitious professionals seeking growth and challenge.
 



  





 This is an exciting opportunity to join a high-performing AI & Data team in a leadership role. As a Director, you will take ownership of complex consulting engagements from strategy through to execution. You’ll work with senior stakeholders to shape their AI and data journeys, deliver transformative outcomes, and play a key role in business development.  For more information, please apply via the link or contact Ryan Daly at Adeptis Group on +44 (0) 2033 013 792 or r.daly@adeptisgroup.com

title: SecOps Engineer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a SecOps Engineer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a SecOps Engineer at Qred, you’ll be a part of the enabler team, supporting our compliance team and cross-functional teams, working in a modern technical stack. We don’t only talk about AWS, serverless and machine learning, we are heavily invested in it. You will advise, collaborate, code and break stuff. Your daily work will probably include the following:
   

  

* You’ll be contributing to all aspects of platform operations, not just security.
* Supporting product teams in their ability to build and secure cloud distributed systems, serverless architectures and container platforms.
* Supporting IT with client security configuration, alerting and response
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify the company needs and requirements and implement the best practices in house.
* Be awesome and hands-on with AWS, IaC, tooling and coding/scripting (python or nodejs).
* Work with product teams to help drive security projects.
* Coordinate any security related issue, both planned and unplanned.
* Security audits of our integrations
* Troubleshooting and support of anything that touches our security related systems for the entire company
* Be or want to be knowledgeable on relevant compliance with technical touchpoints for our industry, EBA ICT guidelines or DORA compliance as an example.


**Here’s what we're looking for:**
* A self-driven person with a flexible, positive mindset and strong team spirit, who loves helping others.
* You can write secure code in at least one language (we use Python and Typescript) and are familiar with secure coding practices (e.g., OWASP).
* You have a (weird) passion for breaking (and fixing) stuff, you see what others don’t.
* At least 5 years experience working with security or cloud ops.
* Solid work experience in AWS and security, preferably in serverless.
* You’ve worked in regulated, compliant environments.
* If you have an AWS certification (Developer, Solution Architect or Sysops) we’ll be extra interested!


**Why join us?**
 Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole cloud architecture, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid and flexible work setup, we do expect you to be in the office three days per week. Ideally, the role would be filled as soon as possible, but we’re happy to agree on a mutually suitable start date for the right candidate.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Cloud Field Engineering Manager
description:
This is an opportunity to run a field engineering team, helping customers understand and implement Canonical's open source solutions in public clouds and in their own data centers. We work across the entire spectrum of cloud offerings, from Ubuntu itself to virtualisation and private cloud, Kubernetes, and the implementation of sophisticated open source solutions such as MLops platforms, data platforms and more. We are rapidly expanding the range of open source solutions we offer and deliver to customers, as we move into new industries like telco, finance, health care and media we design and develop new open source solutions to meet their needs.
   

  

 We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding engineers themselves. They should feel completely at home troubleshooting technical issues and having technical presales conversations with customers. They should contribute to project delivery themselves, but know that the technical contributions they bring are far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery. We grow management skills and train engineers, who are interested in soft skills, to be managers.
   

  

 We believe that open source is just starting to transform the tech sector and enterprise compute. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies'. To deliver on that ambition, our engineers are carefully selected from the applicants across the globe. We select for brilliance and motivation to take open source to the next level. Our engineering managers help teams achieve more than they realised they could, and feel proud of the result.
   

  

**The role of a Cloud Field Engineering Manager at Canonical**
 The Field Engineering team is our team of cloud solutions architects at Canonical, working directly with our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. The portfolio of products includes on-premise cloud solutions such as Openstack, MicroCloud and Ceph, and solutions that could be deployed either on-premises or in public clouds such as Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Spark, PostgreSQL, etc. The team works hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. Managers and team members also take part in presales conversations to provide technical advice during the sales process.
   

  

 A Cloud Field Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role. You are also expected to actively participate in technical presales to help our department achieve our quarterly goals.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be home based, managing a team in your time zone.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Lead and develop a team of Field engineers, ranging from graduate to senior, in the areas of Presales and Professional Services
* Solve customer problems by promoting our technologies and being a trusted advisor
* Work remotely in a single major time zone
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers
* Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders


**What we are looking for in you**
* Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc.
* Practical knowledge of Linux and networking
* Experience in technical presales
* You are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Passion and a track record of developing and growing people
* Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring engineers
* Organised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality results
* An exceptional academic track record from high school and, preferably, university as well
* Willingness to travel up to 40% of the time. Field Engineers attend internal company events, external tech events and customer meetings.


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Second language - Spanish or French preferred
* Python knowledge
* Experience collaborating with external partners
* Experience collaborating with several internal teams and providing stakeholder feedback for engineering roadmaps


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Migration Specialist
description:
**Key Responsibilities:** 





 ·        Architect and design scalable data solutions for migration from Teradata to Snowflake.
 





 ·        Develop robust data models (dimensional and normalized) to support analytical and operational reporting.
 





 ·        Define architecture frameworks and ensure alignment with enterprise standards and cloud best practices.
 





 ·        Design and validate ETL/ELT pipelines using Informatica IDMC.
 





 ·        Work closely with developers and data engineers to ensure design adherence and performance optimization.
 





 ·        Incorporate ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) where applicable for data integration.
 





 ·        Ensure data integrity, lineage, and governance standards are embedded in all solution components.
 





 ·        Support solution reviews, documentation, and cross-functional technical discussions.
 





 ·        Provide mentorship to junior team members and participate in knowledge-sharing sessions.
 









**Required Skills and Experience:** 





 ·        10+ years of total experience with 5+ years in Data Architecture / Design roles.
 





 ·        Hands-on experience with Snowflake and proven track record of Teradata-to-Snowflake migrations.
 





 ·        Expertise in Teradata systems, including performance tuning and legacy data structures.
 





 ·        Experience with Informatica IDMC (Cloud) for ETL/ELT development.
 





 ·        Familiarity with ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is a plus.
 





 ·        Strong knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and data warehousing principles.
 





 ·        Good understanding of data governance, security, and quality management.
 





 ·        Prior experience in the banking or financial services domain is required.
 









**Soft Skills:** 





 ·        Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
 





 ·        Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and manage stakeholders effectively.
 





 ·        Self-driven and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.
 





 ·        Agile mindset with adaptability to evolving project needs.

title: Tech Management Consultant
description:
Are you passionate about bridging business and technology?
 



  





 Do you want to work on impactful tech transformation projects at some of Sweden’s most well-known companies?
 



  





 Influence Tech is expanding, and we’re looking for a Tech Management Consultant with experience in driving technology transformation projects, ERP and other core business system implementations, and cloud optimization to join our growing team.
 



  





  





**What We Offer** 




  




* The opportunity to work on fantastic projects – in areas like IT ERP and HR core system implementation, technology strategy, automation and AI agents, cloud optimization, and IT governance.
* A flat, collaborative company structure focused on work/life balance rather than internal processes.
* Projects that allow you to combine technology capabilities with a human-centric approach.
* A culture that embraces innovation, collective intelligence, and doing things differently.
* An active role in building the future of our company – shaping offerings, practice areas, and recruitment efforts.



  





  





**Your Role** 




  




* Lead and deliver projects and programs within IT and digital transformation, especially in the areas of core business systems (e.g. ERP), IT strategy, or automation & AI agents.
* Work in the space between business and IT, helping clients define needs and turn them into actionable tech initiatives.
* Act as a trusted advisor in technology assessments, system implementations, and strategic IT planning.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and help clients align tech solutions with business goals.
* Mentor junior consultants and contribute to business development and sales.



  





  





**Who We’re Looking For** 




  




* 6-12 years of experience within technology and management consulting, including hands-on leadership of complex, business-critical IT projects.
* Solid experience in delivering and leading projects in one or more of the following areas:



  




* ERP implementation and core system modernization
* Business analysis and technology/business alignment
* IT strategy and governance
* Automation technologies, including AI agents
* Cloud optimization



  




* Proven ability to take on roles such as Program/Project Manager, Technology Lead, or IT Strategy Consultant.
* A strong understanding of business processes and how to align them with the right tech solutions.
* Confident in building client relationships and contributing to sales opportunities.
* University degree (minimum Master’s or similar)
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.



  





  





**About Influence Tech** 




  





 Influence Tech is a growing Tech Management Consulting firm based in Stockholm and part of the
 **Newground Alliance** 
 – a network of 12 niche consulting firms and over 300 consultants. Together, we share the motto
 **“Consulting Done Right”** 
 – delivering lasting value for our clients while ensuring a healthy and balanced workplace for our team. We collaborate closely with our colleagues across Newground Alliance in client engagements, strategic business development, and sales initiatives.
 



  





 We’re building something different – a warm, value-driven, and ambitious company.
 



 As a small firm of around 25-30 people, we work closely together in a flat organization where communication is open and decisions are made quickly. You’ll join a supportive team that values work-life balance and personal growth. If you’re passionate about making a difference and helping organizations get more value from technology – we want to meet you.
 



  





**We review applications continuously – apply today!** 




  





 https://influencetech.se

title: Manager / Senior Manager / Director to Customer – Management Consulting
description:
Are you an experienced professional at Manager to Director level with 5+ years of experience within front-office and customer strategy looking for the next step in your career? Our Management Consulting practice is expanding to meet our clients’ rising and changing demand. We work with many of Sweden’s most interesting organisations, and we need more leaders in our journey. This is an exciting opportunity for you to join a growing, high-performing team at the forefront of customer excellence.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of KPMG’s Customer & Operations practice, you will lead engagements that help our clients drive profitable growth and transform their businesses through performance improvement projects. You will support clients in defining their market and customer strategy, design their customer journey and enable efficient front-office functions to deliver the best customer experience. Many projects involve CRM solutions or analytical tools that help turn data into action.
   

  

 Beyond this, you will play a vital role in shaping KPMG’s growth agenda by identifying new business opportunities, leading commercial dialogues, building senior client relationships and contributing to the development of our people, methods and go-to-market offerings. The role can be placed in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 We believe that you:
   

  

* Have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Engineering or a related field
* Have 5+ years of experience in management consulting or relevant industry roles
* Have led strategy and transformation projects related to customer experience, go-to-market, commercial strategy, customer insight or similar
* Are confident working with senior stakeholders
* Have strong leadership skills and enjoy developing people and teams
* Possess strong business acumen and a proven sales track record
* Are fluent in English
* Experience in working with CRM platforms is considered a merit


**What We Offer**
 We believe in creating the right conditions for our people to grow. At KPMG Management Consulting, you will work in a dynamic environment where client impact, professional development and collaboration go hand in hand. You will help drive change across industries and contribute to a scaling business.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to be part of a fast-growing practice and accelerate your career while shaping the future of operations for leading organisations. We offer:
   

  

* A high-impact leadership role in a fast-growing consulting team
* A collaborative and ambitious culture with skilled colleagues
* A flexible work environment with focus on personal and professional growth
* Clear opportunities for career progression


**Want to make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application also during the summer, the selection process will start in the middle of August.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se. We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!

title: Workspace Sales Specialist, Public Sector, Google Cloud (Multiple Languages)
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:
 **Helsinki, Finland; Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
 **Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience in a sales role in the enterprise software or cloud space.
* Experience selling Software as a Service (SaaS), Productivity, or Collaboration technology solutions to clients.
* Experience in, or supporting public sector institutions.
* Ability to communicate in Danish/Finnish/Norwegian/Icelandic/Swedish fluently, as this is a client-facing role.
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time as needed.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience carrying and exceeding business goals in a sales role.
* Experience prioritizing, planning, and organizing solution-based sales activity within business cycles, including qualifying high value accounts and leveraging our partner ecosystem.
* Experience working with internal/external teams, including account teams, technical leads, procurement, and legal, to inventory existing software estate, build business cases for transformation with implementation plans, and close agreements.
* Experience prospecting, and building and maintaining customer relationships from scratch, with excitement for building Greenfield territories; experience acquiring new logos at scale and securing the foundational workloads to accelerate consumption business.


**About the job** 
 As a Workspace Sales Specialist, you will help us grow our Productivity and Collaboration business by building and expanding relationships with new and existing customers. In this role, you will work with customers to deliver true business value, demonstrate product functionality, and provide a comprehensive overview of key business use cases. You will lead day-to-day relationships with cross-functional team members and external customers, leading with empathy, while identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole to drive overall value for Google Cloud.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build relationships with customers as a subject matter expert and trusted advisor, managing complex business cycles, identifying solution use cases, and influencing long-term strategic direction of accounts.
* Deliver against quota and achieve or exceed strategic business and growth goals while forecasting and reporting your territory’s business.
* Work with Google accounts and cross-functional teams (e.g. Customer Engineering, Marketing, Customer Success, Product, Engineering, Channels) to develop go-to-market strategies, drive pipeline and business growth, close agreements, understand the customer, and provide excellent prospect and customer experience.
* Construct and execute an effective territory development plan.
* Lead prospecting, acquisition, and development of new Workspace opportunities in your assigned territory, creating and building customer relationships from scratch, while also maintaining and building current accounts.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: AWS Senior Sales Specialist, SAP - Nordics Market, Enterprise Apps and Migrations
description:
**Description**
 Are you interested in a business focusing on SAP customers migration to Cloud and the evolutionary transformation of their mission critical SAP workloads?
   

  

 Do you have the business savvy, technical background, and global sales leadership skills necessary to help position AWS as the cloud provider of choice for SAP workloads? AWS is seeking a Specialized Sales Representative in Sweden to help us maintain our leadership position as the preferred cloud for SAP workloads in the Nordics Market.
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.
   

  

 AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power a number of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SCP. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers across all segments than any other cloud provider, is certified to support the largest public cloud (native) SAP S/4HANA (48TB) and BW/4HANA (100TB) deployments, and has more SAP HANA cloud native certifications than other cloud providers .
   

  

 The SAP on AWS team engages SAP customers through 3 routes to market (RTM): the AWS field, consulting partners, and SAP. As the SAP on AWS Specialized Sales Representative for the Nordics within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of AWS solutions for SAP across AWS’s most strategic Nordic customers. You will be responsible for the SAP sales motion in the Nordics, which includes; identifying SAP customers & opportunities, qualifying & building pipeline, driving SAP on AWS discussions with customers, and responsibility for the overall sales cycle. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these stakeholders, you will be responsible for driving top line revenue growth and overall end customer adoption.
   

  

 You'll possess a business background that enables you to engage at CXO level, deep experience with SAP, knowledge of SAP specific infrastructure solutions that will help drive the SAP on AWS ecosystem, as well as a sales background that enables you to easily interact with enterprise customers, partners, and the AWS field teams.
   

  

 You'll also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, and the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.
   

  

* 30% travel required


 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Sales, business development, and program management experience
* Experience selling SAP Applications, and technology
* Prior experience growing SAP or SAP related businesses and Experience working with SAP partners and the SAP ecosystem
* Track record of building rapport with C-Suite customers
* Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Lingual proficiency in one of the Nordic languages
* Extensive customer network
* Experience working with cloud computing technologies/companies


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3004716

title: IAM-specialist
description:
Är du en erfaren IAM-konsult med erfarenhet och hög kompetens inom IAM-området och söker nästa utmaning? Kanske sitter du i en roll idag som IAM-specialist, IAM-analyst eller liknande och nyfiken på en ny utmaning?
 



 Då är du varmt välkommen att hänga med på Avegas framgångsresa och fortsätta att utveckla vårt Säkerhetserbjudande!
 



  





 Som IAM-konsult kommer du att arbeta i uppdrag där du t ex är ansvarig för att designa, implementera och hantera IAM-lösningar för våra kunder. Några av dina arbetsuppgifter kan sträcka sig från att analysera kundernas IAM-behov och identifiera potentiella säkerhetsrisker, utveckla och presentera skräddarsydda IAM-strategier och IAM-lösningar. Man kan jobba med allting från design och implementering, till säkerhetsanalys och riskhantering och efterlevnad. Därför lägger vi stort fokus på konsultens tekniska expertis kring olika IAM-tekniker och plattformar, samt att man även känner sig bekväm med att erbjuda teknisk support till kunder och felsöka och åtgärda tekniska problem i IAM-miljöer.
 



  





 Då Avega vill ligga i framkant med de senaste möjligheterna ser vi även att man vill hålla sig uppdaterad om de senaste IAM-trenderna och teknologierna, och att man kan bidra till utvecklingen av kundens IAM-tjänster och metoder.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT-säkerhet eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IAM-design, implementering och hantering
* Djupgående kunskaper om IAM-tekniker som t ex Active Directory och plattformar som Azure AD, Okta eller andra ledande IAM-plattformar
* Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och integrera IAM-verktyg och -plattformar, inklusive SSO, MFA, RBAC och PIM/PAM
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med kunder och leverera konsulttjänster
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och problemlösningsförmåga



  





**Meriterande kvalifikationer** 



* Certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet och IAM är meriterande
* Konsultbakgrund eller erfarenhet inom flera branscher



 Vi erbjuder dig en dynamisk arbetsplats med härliga kollegor, och sätter därför självklart vikt på de personliga egenskaperna och har som mål att vara våra medarbetares mest utvecklande arbetsplats. Denna kontinuerliga kompentensutveckling sker genom uppdraget som konsulten är med och väljer, samt genom vårt kompetensutvecklingsforum Elevate.
 



  





 Om detta låter som en arbetsplats för dig, vänligen ansök nedan. Ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: IAM Security Engineer
description:
Vi
 *söker nu* 
 en Security Engineer med fokus på IAM/IGA till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Security Engineer med inriktning på IAM/IGA och åtkomstkontroll får du en nyckelroll i att övervaka, drifta och vidareutveckla Bankgirots säkerhetsplattformar för identitetshantering och autentisering. Du arbetar operativt med lösningar som Active Directory, PAM, MFA, PKI och HSM – med syftet att säkerställa att identitetsflöden, accesshantering och autentisering sker säkert, spårbart och i enlighet med regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att samverka med arkitektur- och plattformsområden för att säkerställa effektiva och säkra identitets- och behörighetsflöden samt att stötta verksamheten i tekniska frågor kring access och identitet. Du deltar i säkerhetsgranskningar och revisioner, arbetar med att ansluta applikationer till centrala IDP-lösningar och stödjer automatisering av onboarding/offboarding och övriga IAM-flöden. Du bidrar även till det strategiska förbättringsarbetet av våra kontroller, metoder och dokumentation.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du har en stark säkerhetsmedvetenhet och är van vid att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer där identitets- och åtkomsthantering är en central del av både säkerhets- och compliancearbetet. Med ett strukturerat och analytiskt arbetssätt tar du dig an tekniska utmaningar och bidrar aktivt till förbättringar inom IAM-området.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av teknisk drift och utveckling av IAM-plattformar, inklusive komponenter som Active Directory, PAM, LDAP, MFA, IDP och Access Control. Du har god förståelse för IAM-livscykelhantering, autentisering och olika typer av behörighetsmodeller – och har sannolikt arbetat i miljöer med höga krav på efterlevnad och spårbarhet. Vidare har du kännedom om protokoll som SAML, OIDC, OAuth och WebauthN, samt erfarenhet av federerade identitetslösningar och säker autentisering för API:er. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med lösningar som Curity och Omada, har erfarenhet av automatisering eller skriptning inom IAM samt innehar certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller GIAC.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Sr. Account Executive
description:
**OPENTEXT**
 OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a committed Senior Account Executive with solid technology and business-to-business sales experience to grow the sale of our enterprise information management (EIM) solutions throughout customer organizations in Sweden.
   

  

**What The Role Offers**
* Delivering the sales revenue plan. Achieving or exceeding sales quotas for license, SaaS, maintenance, and services. Growing the business and OpenText´s market share. Responsible for managing costs and discretionary spending, including travel.
* Consultative selling and intensely listening to your customers.
* Preparing comprehensive territory plans.
* Identifying and converting opportunities into sales.
* Skillfully executing each phase of the sales process from pipeline generation to closing the deal.
* Accomplishing client presentations and running effective meetings.
* Clearly articulating the value proposition of solutions and products and the endless possibilities of the digital enterprise to your customers.
* Collaborating across all internal teams and resources and ensuring you bring the best solution to your clients.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* You have a solid track record of B2B selling across the Enterprise.
* You have experience consulting with C-level customers on complex cloud-based, on-premises, or hybrid solutions. You deploy advanced sales methodologies and tools to achieve and exceed your targets.
* You speak English and Swedish fluently.
* A university or bachelor’s degree in combination with several years of enterprise software sales experience and a willingness to travel within the assigned territory.
* You share an intellectual curiosity; you easily grasp new products and solutions, and you bring the spirit of innovation to your customers.


**One last thing**
 If you are passionate about driving business growth and have a proven track record in B2B sales, this role is for you. As a Senior Account Executive at OpenText, you'll have the opportunity to significantly impact our market share in Sweden by delivering innovative EIM solutions to our customers. You'll work with top-level executives, leverage your consultative selling skills, and collaborate with internal teams to provide the best solutions. Join us to take your career to new heights, exceed your sales targets, and be a key player in transforming the digital landscape.
   

  

 OpenText's commitment to diversity and inclusion surpasses legal requirements, evident in our Equal Employment Opportunity Statement of Policy which promotes a respectful and empowering environment for employees of all backgrounds, culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws.
   

  

 If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.

title: Verification Engineer TPS Verification
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


The **Verification Engineer** is involved in all phases of the verification process covering planning, specification, automation, execution


and reporting of all verification activities in product creation projects and modification of existing products.


The **Verification Engineer** works in close collaboration with the design team to develop testable design and provides early feedback


about the performance of the developed products.


Test tool development, configuration management and requirements are also important parts of the verification engineering role.

**Responsibilities:**

* To participate in all activities of a development project, with emphasis on test and verification, requirements engineering, risk analysis, documentation, and configuration management, whilst following company standards
* Design, writing, executing and maintenance of manual and automated software tests
* Perform exploratory and regression testing
* To identify defects and report bugs with a deep attention to details
* To maintain and support test tools and test environments.
* To develop and validate the test tools
* To create and review verification documents
* To review test code, drawings and other design related technical product documents
* Contribute-to technical testing strategies or workflow improvements
* Perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies, and products
* To follow the technical and clinical evolution within the field

**Authorities:**

* To participate in the definition and verification of products
* To approve verification documents according to approved document plans
* To manage the test tools and test environments
* To review and approve verification documents according to approved document plans
* To review code, drawings, and other design related documents
* To review technical product documents

**Relevant knowledge, skills and competencies:**

* Bachelor or M. Sc. Degree or Technical University Graduate in relevant engineering discipline.
* Fluent in written and spoken English

**Hiring process**

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

**Your Elekta contact**

  

For questions, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner responsible, Agata Antonijczuk, at Agata.Antonijczuk@elekta.com.

  

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope. Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and LinkedIn.*

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


The **Software Development Engineer** is involved in the development of the product, associated tools and the continuous integration system.


The **Software Development Engineer** will co-operate within their agile team and with other teams in the Neuro program, using the prescribed methods of coding, review, version control system handling, etc. to deliver their work and to assist others where necessary.

**Responsibilities:**

* To participate in all activities of software R&D projects, with emphasis on requirement specification,
* design, implementation, testing and documentation, whilst following company standards
* To write and review TPS code and code for supporting systems and tools
* To assist other teams in the Engineering department with TPS-related issues when required
* To perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies and products
* To follow the technical and clinical evolution within the field
* Apply agile principles and practices, following SAFe methodology as a member of a scrum team.
* Understand and adhere to the Elekta quality system, and introduce improvements to its effectiveness

  



**Authorities:**

* To participate in the definition and system design of products
* To decide design solutions and implementation of those solutions
* To review code and software-related documents
* To review technical product documents

**Relevant knowledge, skills and competencies:**

* Master of Science in Engineering Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
* Excellent command of English in speech and writing

**Hiring process**

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

**Your Elekta contact**

  

For questions, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner responsible, Agata Antonijczuk, at Agata.Antonijczuk@elekta.com.

  

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope. Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and LinkedIn.*

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


 In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $82.5K - $143K

title: AI-expert
description:
OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: FRA
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, heltid Placeringsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 10 augusti 2025
   

  

 Kvalifikationer: Civilingenjör med AI/ML-inriktning eller motsvarande erfarenhet. Praktisk erfarenhet av arbete med moderna AI-modeller inom språk, ljud och bild. Vana vid Linux, Nvidias GPU:er och Kubernetes-baserade molnmiljöer. Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Meriterande: Doktorsexamen inom AI/ML. Erfarenhet av AWS. Kännedom om offentlig förvaltning och juridiska frågor kopplade till AI och Big Data inom signalunderrättelse. Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete på FRA.
   

  

 Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Myndigheten expanderar inom AI-området - din kompetens är efterfrågad. Vårt framgångsrika Data Science-team behöver nu förstärkas med spetskompetens inom artificiell intelligens och maskininlärning (AI/ML) för att kunna ta sig an fler utmanande uppgifter. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv miljö där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 Som AI-expert hör du till Data Science-teamet inom avdelningen för Signalunderrättelser. Avdelningen arbetar för att ge våra uppdragsgivare underrättelser om omvärlden. Data Science-teamet arbetar huvudsakligen med analys av mycket stora mängder data. Arbetet genomförs genom tillämpad vetenskaplig försöksverksamhet där resultaten baseras på traditionella statistiska metoder. Vi vill förbättra gruppens förmåga att analysera komplexa mönster i data genom att också kunna integrera avancerade AI-modeller. Vi vill också förstärka verksamhetsområdets förmåga att med god vetenskaplighet träna och utvärdera AI-modeller inom fält så som språkteknologi med mera.
   

  

 Resor förekommer i tjänsten, inrikes och utrikes.
   

  

 Du kan
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Civilingenjörsutbildning med tung AI/ML-inriktning, eller annan arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Aktuell praktisk erfarenhet av AI/ML, i synnerhet av arbete med moderna modeller inom språk, ljud och bild.
* Erfarenhet av Linux och Nvidias GPU:er samt deployment i Kubernetes-baserad molnmiljö.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Doktorsexamen inom området AI/ML
* Erfarenhet av användning av AWS till stöd för utveckling och träning av AI/ML
* Grundläggande kännedom om offentlig förvaltning samt insikter i den legala problematik som omgärdar AI och Big Data inom signalunderrättelsetjänst
* Erfarenhet av arbete på FRA


 Du är
   

  

 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som arbetar bra tillsammans med andra och bidrar med din specialistkunskap. Som person är du kreativ och kommer ofta med nya idéer och nya angreppssätt. Vidare har du en god förmåga att arbeta med komplexa problem eller frågeställningar.
   

  

 Om FRA
   

  

 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.seFör din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som arbetar bra tillsammans med andra och bidrar med din specialistkunskap. Som person är du kreativ och kommer ofta med nya idéer och nya angreppssätt. Vidare har du en god förmåga att arbeta med komplexa problem eller frågeställningar.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekrytering@fra.se. Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se senast 2025-08-10.
   

  

 Referensnummer 2025FRA73-3.
   

  

 Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
   

  

 ANSÖK HÄR

title: Senior Rendering Programmer
description:
1 x Lead Rendering Programmer
   

  

 1X Senior Rendering Programmer
   

  

 Avalanche Studios Group is hiring multiple Rendering Programmers for our central technology organisation, Central Tech. Central Tech is our core technology team, and we innovate in areas that push the boundaries of what open-world sandbox gaming means, as well as improve, optimise, and support our existing core technology. In this role, you will work side by side with seasoned professionals with years of experience in developing our proprietary engine and runtime systems. Together, we will design solutions and elevate our engine to new heights.
   

  

 As a Rendering Programmer within Central Tech, you will work with multiple teams, including engine, art, and tech art, in developing the rendering technology for our open-world engine, Apex. You will work with writing performance-critical code to feed the GPU. You will oversee the architecture of the engine's rendering part and should have a strong sense of developing simple, robust, and performant systems. In addition to outstanding technical knowledge, we are looking for a self-motivated individual with strong communication and collaboration skills.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Collaborate closely with cross-disciplinary game project teams, ranging from art to systems
* Responsible for translating project goals into technical goals for the team
* Developing render technology and features that will be used across different platforms and projects
* Oversee the architecture of the rendering technology in the engine
* Identify and resolve graphics-related issues.
* Profile and optimize code to deliver the best possible gaming experience
* Stay informed: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in graphics development. Keep the team informed about emerging best practices and tools


**Who You Are**
* Have at least 3 years of experience in the game industry
* Fluent in C/C++ programming
* Well-versed in modern 3D graphics APIs
* Excellent CPU/GPU performance analysis, optimisation, and debugging skills
* Extensive background in 3D rendering
* Experience in building graphics systems
* Strong math skills


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Liverpool location**
 Our United Kingdom location is in Liverpool, a maritime city with a diverse blend of cultures and a plethora of museums, restaurants, pubs, nightlife, as well as a booming gaming scene. Liverpool’s storied history as a port city is ever-present, and within just an hour you’ll find wide sandy beaches, Chester Zoo, Martin Mere Nature Reserve, and the Southport Pleasureland amusement park. It’s a great city to visit and a perfect place to live.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*
